HP:0000002.name: Abnormality of body height
HP:0000002.definition: Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.
HP:0000002.definition_cn: 偏离年龄和性别标准的身高正常值范围。

HP:0000003.name: Multicystic kidney dysplasia
HP:0000003.definition: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.
HP:0000003.definition_cn: 多囊性肾发育不良的特征是肾脏内存在多个大小不一的囊肿，且缺乏正常的肾盂肾盏系统。该病常伴有输尿管或肾盂输尿管闭锁，受累肾脏无功能。

HP:0000005.name: Mode of inheritance
HP:0000005.definition: The pattern in which a particular genetic trait or disorder is passed from one generation to the next.
HP:0000005.definition_cn: 特定遗传性状或疾病的遗传模式。

HP:0000006.name: Autosomal dominant inheritance
HP:0000006.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.
HP:0000006.definition_cn: 一种遗传模式，涉及由常染色体（即人类1-22号染色体）上的基因编码的性状，该性状在杂合子中表现。在医学遗传学中，当存在单个突变等位基因时，即可导致常染色体显性遗传病。男性和女性患病率相同，且均可将疾病传递给后代，每个孩子继承突变等位基因的风险为50%。

HP:0000007.name: Autosomal recessive inheritance
HP:0000007.definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).
HP:0000007.definition_cn: 一种遗传模式，见于与常染色体（即人类1-22号染色体）上编码的基因相关的性状，该性状在携带两个致病等位基因的个体中表现，无论是纯合子（两个相同的突变等位基因）还是复合杂合子（即基因的两个拷贝各有一个不同的突变等位基因）。

HP:0000008.name: Abnormal morphology of female internal genitalia
HP:0000008.definition: An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.
HP:0000008.name_cn: 女性内生殖器形态异常

HP:0000010.name: Recurrent urinary tract infections
HP:0000010.definition: Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

HP:0000011.name: Neurogenic bladder
HP:0000011.definition: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.
HP:0000011.definition_cn: 一种由神经损伤引起的膀胱功能障碍。神经源性膀胱可分为弛缓性或痉挛性。神经源性膀胱的常见表现包括溢出性尿失禁、尿频、尿急、急迫性尿失禁和尿潴留。

HP:0000012.name: Urinary urgency
HP:0000012.definition: Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.
HP:0000012.definition_cn: 急迫性尿失禁是指强烈且突然的排尿需求。

HP:0000014.name: Abnormality of the bladder
HP:0000014.definition: An abnormality of the urinary bladder.

HP:0000015.name: Bladder diverticulum
HP:0000015.definition: Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.
HP:0000015.definition_cn: 膀胱壁憩室（囊袋或囊状结构）。

HP:0000016.name: Urinary retention
HP:0000016.definition: Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.
HP:0000016.definition_cn: 排尿过程中无法完全排空膀胱。

HP:0000017.name: Nocturia
HP:0000017.definition: Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.

HP:0000019.name: Urinary hesitancy
HP:0000019.definition: Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.

HP:0000020.name: Urinary incontinence
HP:0000020.definition: Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.

HP:0000022.name: Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology
HP:0000022.definition: An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.
HP:0000022.name_cn: 男性内生殖器形态异常

HP:0000023.name: Inguinal hernia
HP:0000023.definition: Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.
HP:0000023.definition_cn: 腹内容物经腹股沟管突出。

HP:0000024.name: Prostatitis
HP:0000024.definition: The presence of inflammation of the prostate.

HP:0000025.name: Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia
HP:0000025.name_cn: 男性内生殖器功能障碍

HP:0000026.name: Male hypogonadism
HP:0000026.definition: Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.
HP:0000026.definition_cn: 男性性腺功能减退，即睾丸功能减退，伴随精子生成减少或睾酮合成降低。

HP:0000027.name: Azoospermia
HP:0000027.definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm,whereby spermatozoa cannot be observed even after centrifugation of the semen pellet.
HP:0000027.definition_cn: 精液中无任何可测量水平的精子，即使在精液沉淀物离心后仍无法观察到精子。

HP:0000028.name: Cryptorchidism
HP:0000028.definition: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
HP:0000028.definition_cn: 睾丸位于腹股沟管内。即由于睾丸未能通过腹股沟管下降至阴囊，导致一侧或双侧睾丸未在阴囊内。

HP:0000029.name: Testicular atrophy
HP:0000029.definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.
HP:0000029.definition_cn: 睾丸（男性性腺）萎缩（消耗性萎缩），表现为体积缩小，并可能导致生育能力丧失。

HP:0000030.name: Testicular gonadoblastoma
HP:0000030.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis.
HP:0000030.definition_cn: 睾丸性腺母细胞瘤的存在。

HP:0000031.name: Epididymitis
HP:0000031.definition: The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.

HP:0000032.name: Abnormal male external genitalia morphology
HP:0000032.definition: Any structural abnormality of male external genitalia.
HP:0000032.name_cn: 男性外生殖器形态异常
HP:0000032.definition_cn: 男性外生殖器结构异常。

HP:0000033.name: Ambiguous genitalia, male
HP:0000033.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.
HP:0000033.definition_cn: XY遗传性别个体的生殖器模糊。

HP:0000034.name: Hydrocele testis
HP:0000034.definition: Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.
HP:0000034.definition_cn: 睾丸鞘膜腔内透明液体积聚。

HP:0000035.name: Abnormal testis morphology
HP:0000035.definition: An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).
HP:0000035.definition_cn: 睾丸异常（男性性腺异常）。

HP:0000036.name: Abnormal penis morphology
HP:0000036.definition: Abnormality of the male external sex organ.

HP:0000037.name: Male pseudohermaphroditism
HP:0000037.definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.
HP:0000037.definition_cn: 两性畸形（Hermaphroditism）指的是性腺形态与外生殖器形态之间的不一致性。在男性假两性畸形（Male Pseudohermaphroditism）中，基因型为男性（XY），而外生殖器表现为不完全男性化、性别模糊或完全女性化。若存在性腺，则为睾丸。

HP:0000039.name: Epispadias
HP:0000039.definition: Epispadias is a urogenital malformation characterized by the failure of the urethral tube to tubularize on the dorsal aspect. Unlike in hypospadias, where the meatus is on the ventral aspect, children with epispadias have a wide-open urethral plate on the dorsum. It is commonly seen as a component in the spectrum of bladder exstrophy-epispadias-complex. Isolated epispadias constitutes less than 10 percent of the total cases of epispadias.
HP:0000039.definition_cn: 尿道上裂是一种泌尿生殖系统畸形，其特征为尿道管在背侧未能管状化。与尿道下裂（尿道口位于腹侧）不同，尿道上裂患儿的背侧存在广泛开放的尿道板。该畸形通常作为膀胱外翻-尿道上裂复合体的一部分出现。孤立性尿道上裂在所有尿道上裂病例中所占比例不足10%。

HP:0000040.name: Long penis
HP:0000040.definition: Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.
HP:0000040.definition_cn: 阴茎长度超过同龄平均值2个标准差以上。

HP:0000041.name: Chordee
HP:0000041.definition: Ventral, lateral, or ventrolateral bowing of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.
HP:0000041.definition_cn: 阴茎干和龟头向腹侧、外侧或腹外侧弯曲超过30度。

HP:0000042.name: Absent external genitalia
HP:0000042.definition: Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.
HP:0000042.definition_cn: Absence of external genitalia in a male or female individual.

HP:0000044.name: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism
HP:0000044.definition: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
HP:0000044.name_cn: 低促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症
HP:0000044.definition_cn: 低促性腺激素性性腺功能减退症的特征是性腺（男性为睾丸，女性为卵巢）功能减退，其原因是缺乏刺激性腺的垂体激素：促卵泡激素（FSH）和促黄体生成激素（LH）。

HP:0000045.name: Abnormal scrotum morphology
HP:0000045.definition: Any structural abnormality of the scrotum, i.e., the sac that contains the testes, epididymis, and the lower part of the spermatic cord.
HP:0000045.definition_cn: 阴囊（即包含睾丸、附睾和精索下部的囊状结构）的任何结构异常。

HP:0000047.name: Hypospadias
HP:0000047.definition: Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.
HP:0000047.definition_cn: 尿道口异常位于阴茎腹侧（下方），其特征为尿道口从阴茎头端移位至阴茎腹侧、阴囊或会阴部。

HP:0000048.name: Bifid scrotum
HP:0000048.definition: Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.

HP:0000049.name: Shawl scrotum
HP:0000049.definition: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.
HP:0000049.definition_cn: 阴囊上缘位于阴茎基底上方。

HP:0000050.name: Hypoplastic male external genitalia
HP:0000050.definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).
HP:0000050.name_cn: 男性外生殖器发育不全
HP:0000050.definition_cn: 部分或全部男性外生殖器官（包括阴茎、阴囊和尿道）发育不全。

HP:0000051.name: Perineal hypospadias
HP:0000051.definition: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.
HP:0000051.definition_cn: 尿道下裂伴尿道口位于会阴区。

HP:0000052.name: Urethral atresia, male
HP:0000052.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.
HP:0000052.definition_cn: 先天性尿道闭锁或尿道口发育不全。

HP:0000053.name: Macroorchidism
HP:0000053.definition: The presence of abnormally large testes.

HP:0000054.name: Micropenis
HP:0000054.definition: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.
HP:0000054.definition_cn: 阴茎异常短小。出生时，正常阴茎长度约为3厘米（从耻骨结节至阴茎尖端的拉伸长度），而小阴茎则小于2.0-2.5厘米。

HP:0000055.name: Abnormal female external genitalia morphology
HP:0000055.definition: Any structural abnormality of the female external genitalia.
HP:0000055.name_cn: 女性外生殖器形态异常
HP:0000055.definition_cn: 女性外生殖器结构异常。

HP:0000056.name: Abnormal clitoris morphology
HP:0000056.definition: Any structural abnormality of the clitoris.

HP:0000058.name: Abnormal labia morphology
HP:0000058.definition: An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.
HP:0000058.definition_cn: 阴唇异常，即外阴外部可见部分的异常。

HP:0000061.name: Ambiguous genitalia, female
HP:0000061.definition: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.
HP:0000061.definition_cn: XX遗传性别个体的生殖器模糊。

HP:0000062.name: Ambiguous genitalia
HP:0000062.definition: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.
HP:0000062.definition_cn: 一种无法明确归属于单一性别的生殖器表型。模糊生殖器可通过Prader量表进行评估：Prader 0：正常女性外生殖器。Prader 1：女性外生殖器伴阴蒂肥大。Prader 2：阴蒂肥大伴部分阴唇融合，形成漏斗形泌尿生殖窦。Prader 3：阴茎增大明显，完全阴唇阴囊融合，形成单一开口的泌尿生殖窦。Prader 4：完全阴囊融合，泌尿生殖开口位于阴茎基部或阴茎干。Prader 5：正常男性外生殖器。模糊生殖器的诊断适用于Prader 1-4。

HP:0000063.name: Fused labia minora
HP:0000063.definition: Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.
HP:0000063.definition_cn: 小阴唇粘连导致的小阴唇融合，进而引起阴道阻塞。

HP:0000067.name: Urethral atresia, female
HP:0000067.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.
HP:0000067.definition_cn: 女性尿道闭锁或尿道开口发育不全的先天性异常。

HP:0000068.name: Urethral atresia
HP:0000068.definition: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.
HP:0000068.definition_cn: 先天性尿道闭锁或尿道口发育不全。

HP:0000069.name: Abnormality of the ureter
HP:0000069.definition: An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.
HP:0000069.definition_cn: 输尿管异常。输尿管是尿液从肾脏输送至膀胱的管道。

HP:0000070.name: Ureterocele
HP:0000070.definition: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.
HP:0000070.definition_cn: 输尿管囊肿是一种先天性远端输尿管囊状扩张。

HP:0000071.name: Ureteral stenosis
HP:0000071.definition: The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.
HP:0000071.definition_cn: 输尿管狭窄（即输尿管缩窄）的存在。

HP:0000072.name: Hydroureter
HP:0000072.definition: The distention of the ureter with urine.

HP:0000073.name: Ureteral duplication
HP:0000073.definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.
HP:0000073.definition_cn: 一种发育异常，其特征是存在两条而非一条输尿管将肾脏与膀胱连接。

HP:0000074.name: Ureteropelvic junction obstruction
HP:0000074.definition: Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.
HP:0000074.name_cn: 输尿管肾盂连接部梗阻
HP:0000074.definition_cn: 肾盂至近端输尿管尿流梗阻。

HP:0000075.name: Renal duplication
HP:0000075.definition: A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.
HP:0000075.definition_cn: 先天性尿路畸形，表现为肾脏重复畸形，并通过两个独立的肾盂和输尿管引流。

HP:0000076.name: Vesicoureteral reflux
HP:0000076.definition: Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.
HP:0000076.definition_cn: 尿液从膀胱异常（逆行）流入输尿管或肾脏，与输尿管膀胱连接处瓣膜机制功能不全或其他原因相关。

HP:0000078.name: Abnormality of the genital system
HP:0000078.definition: An abnormality of the genital system.

HP:0000079.name: Abnormality of the urinary system
HP:0000079.definition: An abnormality of the urinary system.

HP:0000080.name: Abnormality of reproductive system physiology
HP:0000080.definition: An abnormal functionality of the genital system.
HP:0000080.name_cn: 生殖系统生理功能异常

HP:0000081.name: Duplicated collecting system
HP:0000081.definition: A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.
HP:0000081.definition_cn: 肾集合系统重复畸形，定义为肾脏具有两个（而非通常的一个）肾盂肾盏系统。肾盂肾盏系统由肾盂和肾盏组成。重复的肾集合系统可伴有单一输尿管或双输尿管。在后一种情况下，两条输尿管分别排入膀胱或融合形成单一输尿管开口。

HP:0000083.name: Renal insufficiency
HP:0000083.definition: A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.
HP:0000083.definition_cn: 肾功能减退，表现为尿液浓缩功能下降、废物清除能力降低、电解质平衡失调、血压稳态失衡以及钙代谢异常。

HP:0000085.name: Horseshoe kidney
HP:0000085.definition: A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.
HP:0000085.definition_cn: 左右肾脏通过跨越中线的功能性肾实质或纤维组织峡部相连。

HP:0000086.name: Ectopic kidney
HP:0000086.definition: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.

HP:0000090.name: Nephronophthisis
HP:0000090.definition: Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.
HP:0000090.definition_cn: 肾皮质髓质交界处囊肿伴肾小管间质纤维化。

HP:0000091.name: Abnormal renal tubule morphology
HP:0000091.definition: An abnormality of the renal tubules.

HP:0000092.name: Renal tubular atrophy
HP:0000092.definition: The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.
HP:0000092.definition_cn: 存在肾小管基底膜增厚冗余，或与周围非萎缩性肾小管相比，肾小管直径减少超过50%。

HP:0000093.name: Proteinuria
HP:0000093.definition: Increased levels of protein in the urine.

HP:0000095.name: Abnormal renal glomerulus morphology
HP:0000095.definition: A structural anomaly of the glomerulus.

HP:0000096.name: Glomerular sclerosis
HP:0000096.definition: Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.
HP:0000096.definition_cn: 肾小球内瘢痕组织积聚。

HP:0000097.name: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis
HP:0000097.definition: Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.
HP:0000097.name_cn: 局灶节段性肾小球硬化症
HP:0000097.definition_cn: 部分肾小球（非全部）内瘢痕组织的节段性积聚。

HP:0000098.name: Tall stature
HP:0000098.definition: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.
HP:0000098.definition_cn: 身高超过年龄和性别标准的预期值。

HP:0000100.name: Nephrotic syndrome
HP:0000100.definition: Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.
HP:0000100.definition_cn: 肾病综合征是由肾小球功能障碍引起的一系列临床表现，其特征为肾小球毛细血管壁通透性增加，伴随显著的蛋白尿。肾病综合征是指由严重肾脏蛋白丢失所导致的一系列临床征象，包括蛋白尿、低白蛋白血症、水肿和高脂血症。

HP:0000103.name: Polyuria
HP:0000103.definition: An increased rate of urine production.

HP:0000104.name: Renal agenesis
HP:0000104.definition: Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.
HP:0000104.definition_cn: 肾发育不全，即胚胎发生和发育过程中肾脏未能形成。

HP:0000105.name: Enlarged kidney
HP:0000105.definition: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

HP:0000107.name: Renal cyst
HP:0000107.definition: A fluid filled sac in the kidney.

HP:0000108.name: Renal corticomedullary cysts
HP:0000108.definition: The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.
HP:0000108.definition_cn: 肾皮质与髓质交界处存在多发性囊肿。

HP:0000110.name: Renal dysplasia
HP:0000110.definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

HP:0000111.name: Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia
HP:0000111.definition: Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells.
HP:0000111.name_cn: 肾小球旁细胞肥大/增生
HP:0000111.definition_cn: 肾小球旁细胞数量增多及体积增大。

HP:0000112.name: Nephropathy
HP:0000112.definition: A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.
HP:0000112.definition_cn: 肾病的非特异性术语，指肾脏疾病或损伤。

HP:0000113.name: Polycystic kidney dysplasia
HP:0000113.definition: The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.

HP:0000114.name: Proximal tubulopathy
HP:0000114.definition: Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.
HP:0000114.definition_cn: 近端小管功能障碍，即肾单位导管系统中从肾小囊延伸至亨利袢的部分发生功能异常。

HP:0000117.name: Renal phosphate wasting
HP:0000117.definition: High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.

HP:0000119.name: Abnormality of the genitourinary system
HP:0000119.definition: The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary system.
HP:0000119.definition_cn: 泌尿生殖系统异常的存在。

HP:0000121.name: Nephrocalcinosis
HP:0000121.definition: Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.
HP:0000121.definition_cn: 肾钙质沉着症是指钙盐在肾实质中的沉积。

HP:0000122.name: Unilateral renal agenesis
HP:0000122.definition: A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

HP:0000123.name: Nephritis
HP:0000123.definition: The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney.

HP:0000124.name: Renal tubular dysfunction
HP:0000124.definition: Abnormal function of the renal tubule. The basic functional unit of the kidney, the nephron, consists of a renal corpuscle attached to a renal tubule, with roughly 0.8 to 1.5 nephrons per adult kidney. The functions of the renal tubule include reabsorption of water, electrolytes, glucose, and amino acids and secretion of substances such as uric acid.
HP:0000124.definition_cn: 肾小管功能异常。肾脏的基本功能单位是肾单位，由肾小体和肾小管组成，每个成人肾脏大约有0.8至1.5百万个肾单位。肾小管的功能包括水、电解质、葡萄糖和氨基酸的重吸收，以及尿酸等物质的分泌。

HP:0000125.name: Pelvic kidney
HP:0000125.definition: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.
HP:0000125.definition_cn: 一种发育缺陷，表现为肾脏位于盆腔内的异常解剖位置。

HP:0000126.name: Hydronephrosis
HP:0000126.definition: Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.
HP:0000126.definition_cn: 肾脏严重扩张伴肾盂和肾盏扩张。

HP:0000127.name: Renal salt wasting
HP:0000127.definition: A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s).
HP:0000127.definition_cn: 尿液中一种或多种电解质浓度升高，同时血清中该电解质浓度降低。

HP:0000128.name: Renal potassium wasting
HP:0000128.definition: High urine potassium in the presence of hypokalemia.
HP:0000128.definition_cn: 低钾血症伴尿钾排泄增多。

HP:0000131.name: Uterine leiomyoma
HP:0000131.definition: The presence of a leiomyoma of the uterus.

HP:0000132.name: Menorrhagia
HP:0000132.definition: Prolonged and excessive menses at regular intervals in excess of 80 mL or lasting longer than 7 days.
HP:0000132.definition_cn: 周期性月经量过多，超过80毫升或持续时间超过7天。

HP:0000133.name: Gonadal dysgenesis
HP:0000133.definition: Gonadal dysgenesis is the name given to any of a multitude of conditions that can cause impaired development of the gonads, i.e., the testes or ovaries, or to the related phenotypic features. The term is to be avoided if possible for new annotations, and more specific terms should be chosen.
HP:0000133.definition_cn: 性腺发育不全（Gonadal dysgenesis）是指一系列可导致性腺（即睾丸或卵巢）发育障碍或相关表型特征的疾病的总称。在可能的情况下，应避免使用该术语进行新的注释，而应选择更具体的术语。

HP:0000134.name: Female hypogonadism
HP:0000134.definition: Decreased functionality of the female gonads, i.e., of the ovary.
HP:0000134.definition_cn: 女性性腺功能减退，即卵巢功能减退。

HP:0000135.name: Hypogonadism
HP:0000135.definition: A decreased functionality of the gonad.

HP:0000136.name: Bifid uterus
HP:0000136.definition: The presence of a bifid uterus.

HP:0000138.name: Ovarian cyst
HP:0000138.definition: The presence of one or more cysts of the ovary.

HP:0000139.name: Uterine prolapse
HP:0000139.definition: The presence of prolapse of the uterus.

HP:0000140.name: Abnormality of the menstrual cycle
HP:0000140.definition: An abnormality of the ovulation cycle.

HP:0000141.name: Amenorrhea
HP:0000141.definition: Absence of menses for an interval of time equivalent to a total of more than (or equal to) 3 previous cycles or 6 months.
HP:0000141.definition_cn: 闭经（Amenorrhea）持续时间相当于既往连续3个月经周期或6个月以上。

HP:0000142.name: Abnormal vagina morphology
HP:0000142.definition: Any structural abnormality of the vagina.

HP:0000143.name: Rectovaginal fistula
HP:0000143.definition: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the rectum.

HP:0000148.name: Vaginal atresia
HP:0000148.definition: Congenital occlusion of the vagina or adhesion of the walls of the vagina causing occlusion.
HP:0000148.definition_cn: 先天性阴道闭锁或阴道壁粘连导致的闭锁。

HP:0000149.name: Ovarian gonadoblastoma
HP:0000149.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the ovary.
HP:0000149.definition_cn: 卵巢性腺母细胞瘤的存在。

HP:0000150.name: Gonadoblastoma
HP:0000150.definition: The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements.
HP:0000150.definition_cn: 性腺母细胞瘤的存在，这是一种由生殖细胞和性索成分聚集构成的性腺肿瘤。

HP:0000151.name: Aplasia of the uterus
HP:0000151.definition: A congenital defect characterized by absence of the uterus. Aplasia refers to the failure of an organ to develop during embryonic growth and development due to the absence of primordial tissue.
HP:0000151.definition_cn: 先天性子宫缺失。发育不全是指在胚胎生长发育过程中由于原始组织缺失导致器官未能发育。

HP:0000152.name: Abnormality of head or neck
HP:0000152.definition: An abnormality of head and neck.

HP:0000154.name: Wide mouth
HP:0000154.definition: Distance between the oral commissures more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased width of the oral aperture (subjective).
HP:0000154.definition_cn: 口角间距超过平均值2个标准差。或者，口腔开口宽度明显增加（主观判断）。

HP:0000155.name: Oral ulcer
HP:0000155.definition: Erosion of the mucous mebrane of the mouth with local excavation of the surface, resulting from the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.
HP:0000155.definition_cn: 口腔黏膜糜烂伴局部表面凹陷，由炎性坏死组织脱落所致。

HP:0000158.name: Macroglossia
HP:0000158.definition: Increased length and width of the tongue.

HP:0000160.name: Narrow mouth
HP:0000160.definition: Distance between the commissures of the mouth more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective).
HP:0000160.definition_cn: 口角间距低于平均值2个标准差以上。或表现为口腔开口宽度明显减小（主观判断）。

HP:0000161.name: Median cleft upper lip
HP:0000161.definition: A type of cleft lip presenting as a midline (median) gap in the upper lip.
HP:0000161.definition_cn: 一种表现为上唇中线（正中）裂隙的唇裂类型。

HP:0000162.name: Glossoptosis
HP:0000162.definition: Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a tongue that is mislocalised posteriorly.
HP:0000162.definition_cn: 舌后移进入咽部，即舌体向后错位。

HP:0000163.name: Abnormal oral cavity morphology
HP:0000163.definition: Abnormality of the oral cavity, i.e., the opening or hollow part of the mouth.
HP:0000163.definition_cn: 口腔异常，即口腔开口或空腔部分的异常。

HP:0000168.name: Abnormality of the gingiva
HP:0000168.definition: Any abnormality of the gingiva (also known as gums).

HP:0000169.name: Gingival fibromatosis
HP:0000169.definition: The presence of fibrosis of the gingiva.

HP:0000171.name: Microglossia
HP:0000171.definition: Decreased length and width of the tongue.

HP:0000172.name: Abnormal uvula morphology
HP:0000172.definition: Abnormality of the uvula, the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.
HP:0000172.definition_cn: 悬雍垂异常，即软腭中部后缘的圆锥形突起异常。

HP:0000174.name: Abnormal palate morphology
HP:0000174.definition: Any abnormality of the palate, i.e., of roof of the mouth.
HP:0000174.definition_cn: 腭部异常，即口腔顶部结构的任何异常。

HP:0000175.name: Cleft palate
HP:0000175.definition: Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).
HP:0000175.definition_cn: 腭裂是一种由于腭突融合失败导致的腭部发育缺陷，表现为口腔顶部（软腭和硬腭）的分离。

HP:0000176.name: Submucous cleft hard palate
HP:0000176.definition: Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.
HP:0000176.definition_cn: 硬腭黏膜下裂的特征是骨性腭中线存在骨性缺损，并被口腔顶部的黏膜覆盖。通过触诊可能检测到硬腭黏膜下裂，表现为骨性腭的切迹。

HP:0000177.name: Abnormal upper lip morphology
HP:0000177.definition: An abnormality of the upper lip.

HP:0000178.name: Abnormal lower lip morphology
HP:0000178.definition: An abnormality of the lower lip.

HP:0000179.name: Thick lower lip vermilion
HP:0000179.definition: Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).
HP:0000179.definition_cn: 下唇厚度增加，导致下唇外观突出。下唇唇红中线高度超过平均值2个标准差。或者，正面观下唇唇红高度明显增加（主观判断）。

HP:0000180.name: Lobulated tongue
HP:0000180.definition: Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour.
HP:0000180.definition_cn: 舌缘和/或舌面出现多处凹陷和/或隆起，导致舌面轮廓不规则。

HP:0000183.name: Tongue muscle weakness
HP:0000183.definition: Reduced strength of the tongue musculature, resulting in difficulties moving the tongue and possible accompanied by dysarthria or dysphagia.
HP:0000183.definition_cn: 舌肌肌力减退，导致舌运动困难，可能伴随构音障碍或吞咽障碍。

HP:0000185.name: Cleft soft palate
HP:0000185.definition: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.
HP:0000185.definition_cn: 软腭裂（也称为腭帆或肌性腭）是由于妊娠第7至12周期间发育缺陷所致。软腭裂可导致咽鼓管功能异常，进而引发中耳畸形和听力困难，以及由于腭咽闭合不全导致的鼻音过重相关的言语问题。

HP:0000188.name: Short upper lip
HP:0000188.definition: Decreased width of the upper lip.

HP:0000189.name: Narrow palate
HP:0000189.definition: Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective).
HP:0000189.definition_cn: 腭宽度低于平均值2个标准差以上（客观）或腭宽度明显减小（主观）。

HP:0000190.name: Abnormal oral frenulum morphology
HP:0000190.definition: An abnormality of the lingual frenulum, that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.
HP:0000190.definition_cn: 舌系带异常，即连接舌与口腔底部的小粘膜皱襞异常，或口腔内存在副系带。

HP:0000191.name: Accessory oral frenulum
HP:0000191.definition: Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.
HP:0000191.definition_cn: 从牙槽嵴延伸至上唇或下唇内表面的额外组织皱襞。

HP:0000193.name: Bifid uvula
HP:0000193.definition: Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.
HP:0000193.definition_cn: 悬雍垂分叉，最易见于尖端。

HP:0000194.name: Open mouth
HP:0000194.definition: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth.
HP:0000194.definition_cn: 口面部特征表现为持续性或近乎持续性的张口状态。

HP:0000196.name: Lower lip pit
HP:0000196.definition: Depression located on the vermilion of the lower lip, usually paramedian.
HP:0000196.definition_cn: 下唇红唇部凹陷，通常位于中线旁。

HP:0000197.name: Abnormal parotid gland morphology
HP:0000197.definition: Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.
HP:0000197.definition_cn: 腮腺异常，腮腺为位于面部下颌支上方皮下组织及外耳前下方的唾液腺。

HP:0000200.name: Short lingual frenulum
HP:0000200.definition: The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.

HP:0000201.name: Pierre-Robin sequence
HP:0000201.definition: Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.
HP:0000201.definition_cn: 皮埃尔·罗宾畸形是一种发育畸形序列，其特征包括小颌畸形（下颌发育不全）、舌后坠和腭裂。

HP:0000202.name: Orofacial cleft
HP:0000202.definition: The presence of a cleft (gap, opening, or groove) in the oral cavity, including cleft of the upper lip and/or cleft of the palate. Cleft of the upper lip is visible as a groove or fissure in the lip, most frequently due to a congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse. Cleft palate is characterized by a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth, most often resulting from a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.
HP:0000202.definition_cn: 口腔内存在裂隙（间隙、开口或沟槽），包括上唇裂和/或腭裂。上唇裂表现为唇部的沟槽或裂隙，最常见的原因是上颌突与中鼻突先天性融合失败。腭裂的特征是口腔顶部的沟状凹陷或裂隙，通常是由于腭部先天性未能正常融合所致。唇裂和腭裂可单独发生或同时发生。建议分别对每种缺陷进行编码。

HP:0000204.name: Cleft upper lip
HP:0000204.definition: A gap or groove in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.
HP:0000204.definition_cn: 上唇裂或上唇沟。这是一种由于胚胎发育过程中唇部组织未融合而导致的先天性缺陷。

HP:0000205.name: Pursed lips
HP:0000205.definition: An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.
HP:0000205.definition_cn: 面部外观异常，由持续唇部收缩导致，呈现皱缩或撅起状。

HP:0000207.name: Triangular mouth
HP:0000207.definition: The presence of a triangular form of the mouth.

HP:0000211.name: Trismus
HP:0000211.definition: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.

HP:0000212.name: Gingival overgrowth
HP:0000212.definition: Hyperplasia of the gingiva (that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.
HP:0000212.definition_cn: 牙龈增生（即覆盖牙槽嵴的软组织增厚。增厚程度从仅累及牙间乳头到牙龈过度生长覆盖整个牙冠不等）。

HP:0000214.name: Lip telangiectasia
HP:0000214.definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.
HP:0000214.definition_cn: 唇部毛细血管扩张症（即存在浅表小血管扩张）。

HP:0000215.name: Thick upper lip vermilion
HP:0000215.definition: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).
HP:0000215.definition_cn: 上唇红中线高度超过平均值2个标准差。或者，正面观上唇红高度明显增加（主观判断）。

HP:0000217.name: Xerostomia
HP:0000217.definition: Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.
HP:0000217.definition_cn: 口腔干燥症（Xerostomia）因唾液腺功能障碍所致。

HP:0000218.name: High palate
HP:0000218.definition: Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).
HP:0000218.definition_cn: 腭高超过平均值2个标准差（客观标准）或第一恒磨牙水平处腭高超过牙齿高度的两倍（主观标准）。

HP:0000219.name: Thin upper lip vermilion
HP:0000219.definition: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).
HP:0000219.definition_cn: 上唇红中线高度低于平均值2个标准差以上。或者，正面观上唇红高度明显降低（主观判断）。

HP:0000220.name: Velopharyngeal insufficiency
HP:0000220.definition: Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.
HP:0000220.definition_cn: 腭咽括约肌在言语过程中无法充分分隔鼻腔与口腔。

HP:0000221.name: Furrowed tongue
HP:0000221.definition: Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.

HP:0000224.name: Hypogeusia
HP:0000224.definition: A decreased ability to perceive flavor.

HP:0000227.name: Tongue telangiectasia
HP:0000227.definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.
HP:0000227.definition_cn: 舌毛细血管扩张症（即舌表面小血管扩张）。

HP:0000228.name: Oral cavity telangiectasia
HP:0000228.definition: Presence of telangiectases in the oral cavity.
HP:0000228.definition_cn: 口腔毛细血管扩张症的存在。

HP:0000232.name: Everted lower lip vermilion
HP:0000232.definition: An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.
HP:0000232.definition_cn: 下唇外翻畸形，即下唇向外翻转，使得下唇红唇内侧（通常与牙齿相对）在正面观中可见。

HP:0000233.name: Thin vermilion border
HP:0000233.definition: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).
HP:0000233.definition_cn: 唇内侧朱红色部分高度低于平均值2个标准差以上，或正面观唇朱红色部分高度明显减少。朱红色即唇的红色部分（值得注意的是，朱红色本身也常被等同于唇部）。

HP:0000235.name: Abnormal cranial suture/fontanelle morphology
HP:0000235.definition: Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments).
HP:0000235.definition_cn: 囟门（由厚膜覆盖的区域，通常在生命的前两年内骨化）或颅缝（颅骨关节骨或软骨通过缝韧带连接的纤维关节）的任何异常。

HP:0000236.name: Abnormal anterior fontanelle morphology
HP:0000236.definition: An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.
HP:0000236.definition_cn: 前囟异常，即位于冠状缝与矢状缝交汇处的颅囟异常。

HP:0000237.name: Small anterior fontanelle
HP:0000237.definition: Abnormally decreased size of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.
HP:0000237.definition_cn: 相对于年龄相关标准，前囟异常缩小。

HP:0000238.name: Hydrocephalus
HP:0000238.definition: Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.
HP:0000238.definition_cn: 脑积水是由于脑脊液（CSF）从脑室内的产生部位到其被体循环吸收部位的流动受阻，导致脑室系统主动扩张的一种病理状态。

HP:0000239.name: Large fontanelles
HP:0000239.definition: In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.
HP:0000239.definition_cn: 在新生儿中，两块额骨、两块顶骨和一块枕骨通过纤维性骨缝连接，形成较小的后囟和较大的菱形前囟。这些区域使颅骨能够通过产道并为后续生长提供空间。囟门逐渐骨化，后囟通常在出生后8周闭合，前囟则在9至16个月龄时闭合。若囟门大小超过年龄相关标准，则诊断为囟门过大。

HP:0000240.name: Abnormality of skull size
HP:0000240.definition: Any abnormality of the size of the skull.

HP:0000242.name: Parietal bossing
HP:0000242.definition: Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.
HP:0000242.definition_cn: 顶骨隆起是指顶骨区域显著突出的现象。

HP:0000243.name: Trigonocephaly
HP:0000243.definition: Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.
HP:0000243.definition_cn: 楔形头或三角头，三角形的顶点位于前额中线，三角形的基底位于枕部。

HP:0000244.name: Brachyturricephaly
HP:0000244.definition: Abnormal vertical height of the skull and a shortening of its anterior-posterior length, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.
HP:0000244.definition_cn: 颅骨垂直高度异常及前后径缩短，常合并枕区畸形。

HP:0000245.name: Abnormal paranasal sinus morphology
HP:0000245.definition: Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.
HP:0000245.definition_cn: 鼻旁窦（颅窦）异常，鼻旁窦为位于颅骨和面部骨骼内的含气腔隙，并与鼻腔相通。鼻旁窦包括上颌窦、额窦、筛窦和蝶窦。

HP:0000246.name: Sinusitis
HP:0000246.definition: Inflammation of the paranasal sinuses owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.
HP:0000246.definition_cn: 鼻旁窦炎，由病毒、细菌或真菌感染、过敏或自身免疫反应引起。

HP:0000248.name: Brachycephaly
HP:0000248.definition: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.
HP:0000248.definition_cn: 颅骨形态异常，表现为前后径减小。即，头指数大于81%。或者，与宽度相比，头部前后径（长度）明显缩短。

HP:0000250.name: Dense calvaria
HP:0000250.definition: An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.
HP:0000250.definition_cn: 颅骨骨质密度异常增高。

HP:0000252.name: Microcephaly
HP:0000252.definition: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender.
HP:0000252.definition_cn: 头围低于同年龄和性别平均值的2个标准差。

HP:0000253.name: Progressive microcephaly
HP:0000253.definition: Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.
HP:0000253.definition_cn: 进行性小头畸形的诊断标准为头围逐渐落后于年龄和性别相关的正常范围。

HP:0000256.name: Macrocephaly
HP:0000256.definition: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.
HP:0000256.definition_cn: 枕额（头）围大于与年龄、性别相匹配的正常标准的第97百分位数。或者，颅骨大小明显增加。

HP:0000260.name: Wide anterior fontanel
HP:0000260.definition: Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.
HP:0000260.definition_cn: 前囟门相对于年龄相关标准的扩大。

HP:0000262.name: Turricephaly
HP:0000262.definition: Tall head relative to width and length.
HP:0000262.definition_cn: 相对于宽度和长度而言，头部较高。

HP:0000263.name: Oxycephaly
HP:0000263.definition: Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.
HP:0000263.definition_cn: 尖头畸形（源自希腊语“oxus”，意为尖锐，和“kephalos”，意为头部）指的是颅骨呈圆锥形或尖形的形态。

HP:0000264.name: Abnormal mastoid morphology
HP:0000264.definition: An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.
HP:0000264.definition_cn: 乳突异常，即从颞骨乳突部底面突出的锥形突起。

HP:0000267.name: Cranial asymmetry
HP:0000267.definition: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.

HP:0000268.name: Dolichocephaly
HP:0000268.definition: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.
HP:0000268.definition_cn: 颅骨形态异常，特征为前后径增大，即颅骨前后维度增加。头指数小于76%。或表现为头部前后长度相对于宽度明显增加。通常由于矢状缝过早闭合所致。

HP:0000269.name: Prominent occiput
HP:0000269.definition: Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull).
HP:0000269.definition_cn: 枕骨凸度增加（颅骨后部）。

HP:0000270.name: Delayed cranial suture closure
HP:0000270.definition: Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.
HP:0000270.definition_cn: 新生儿通常出生时具有两个囟门，位于冠状缝和矢状缝交界处的菱形前囟，以及位于枕骨和顶骨交界处的后囟。后囟通常在出生后第8周闭合，前囟平均在出生后第18个月闭合。若囟门闭合延迟超过正常年龄，则适用此术语。

HP:0000272.name: Malar flattening
HP:0000272.definition: Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.
HP:0000272.definition_cn: 颧骨（哺乳动物中的颧骨）的颧突发育不全，可通过侧面观察、正面观察和/或触诊进行评估。

HP:0000274.name: Small face
HP:0000274.definition: A face that is short and narrow.

HP:0000275.name: Narrow face
HP:0000275.definition: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).
HP:0000275.definition_cn: 双侧颧骨（上面部）和双侧下颌角（下面部）宽度均低于平均值超过2个标准差（客观标准）；或，上下颌面部宽度明显减小（主观标准）。

HP:0000276.name: Long face
HP:0000276.definition: Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective).
HP:0000276.definition_cn: 面部高度（长度）超过平均值2个标准差以上（客观）；或，面部高度（长度）明显增加（主观）。

HP:0000277.name: Abnormal mandible morphology
HP:0000277.definition: Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw.

HP:0000278.name: Retrognathia
HP:0000278.definition: An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

HP:0000280.name: Coarse facial features
HP:0000280.definition: Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.
HP:0000280.definition_cn: 眉、鼻、唇、口及下颌轮廓精细锐利度缺失，通常由于圆钝且厚重的面部特征或皮肤增厚所致，伴或不伴皮下及骨组织增厚。

HP:0000283.name: Broad face
HP:0000283.definition: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).
HP:0000283.definition_cn: 颧骨间（上面部）和下颌角间（下面部）宽度超过平均值2个标准差以上（客观）；或面部宽度明显增加（主观）。

HP:0000284.name: obsolete Abnormality of the ocular region

HP:0000286.name: Epicanthus
HP:0000286.definition: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.
HP:0000286.definition_cn: 上睑内侧皮肤皱襞，呈弧形向下延伸，覆盖、经过并位于内眦前方及外侧。

HP:0000287.name: Increased facial adipose tissue
HP:0000287.definition: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
HP:0000287.definition_cn: 面部皮下脂肪组织增多。

HP:0000289.name: Broad philtrum
HP:0000289.definition: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.
HP:0000289.definition_cn: 人中嵴间距，测量于唇红缘正上方，超过平均值2个标准差以上，或表现为明显增宽的人中嵴间距。

HP:0000292.name: Loss of facial adipose tissue
HP:0000292.definition: Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
HP:0000292.definition_cn: 面部正常皮下脂肪组织丧失。

HP:0000293.name: Full cheeks
HP:0000293.definition: Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible.
HP:0000293.definition_cn: 颧骨与下颌骨之间软组织突出度或圆润度增加。

HP:0000294.name: Low anterior hairline
HP:0000294.definition: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella.
HP:0000294.definition_cn: 发际线（trichion）与眉间点（glabella，即鼻根上方额骨最突出点）之间的中线距离，低于平均值两个标准差（SD）以上。或者，发际线与眉间点之间的距离明显缩短。

HP:0000295.name: Doll-like facies
HP:0000295.definition: A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin.
HP:0000295.definition_cn: 特征性面部外观，表现为圆形面部轮廓、丰满的面颊、短鼻以及相对较小的下颌。

HP:0000297.name: Facial hypotonia
HP:0000297.definition: Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
HP:0000297.definition_cn: 面神经（第七对颅神经）支配的肌肉肌张力减退。

HP:0000298.name: Mask-like facies
HP:0000298.definition: A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth.
HP:0000298.definition_cn: 面部表情缺失，常伴有凝视和轻微张口。

HP:0000300.name: Oval face
HP:0000300.definition: A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.
HP:0000300.definition_cn: 面部轮廓呈圆形且略呈椭圆形。

HP:0000301.name: Abnormality of facial musculature
HP:0000301.definition: An anomaly of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
HP:0000301.definition_cn: 面神经（第七颅神经）支配的肌肉异常。

HP:0000303.name: Mandibular prognathia
HP:0000303.definition: Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible.
HP:0000303.definition_cn: 下颌骨长度增加导致的下巴异常突出。

HP:0000306.name: Abnormality of the chin
HP:0000306.definition: An abnormality of the chin, i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.
HP:0000306.definition_cn: 下颌异常，即面部下部的异常，位于下唇下方，包括下颌中央突起部分。

HP:0000307.name: Pointed chin
HP:0000307.definition: A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin.

HP:0000308.name: Microretrognathia
HP:0000308.definition: A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.
HP:0000308.definition_cn: 一种下颌骨发育不全的形式，表现为下颌骨向后错位。

HP:0000309.name: Abnormal midface morphology
HP:0000309.definition: An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.
HP:0000309.definition_cn: 中面部异常，中面部是一个区域而非解剖学术语。其上方起自眶下缘，下方延伸至鼻基底水平。中面部由上颌骨（上颌）、颧骨、颊部及颧区构成。传统上，鼻部和前颌骨不包括在中面部范围内。

HP:0000311.name: Round face
HP:0000311.definition: The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.
HP:0000311.definition_cn: 正面观面部轮廓呈圆形，较正常形态更为显著。

HP:0000316.name: Hypertelorism
HP:0000316.definition: Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).
HP:0000316.definition_cn: 瞳孔间距超过平均值2个标准差以上（或表现为瞳孔间距增大或眼距过宽）。

HP:0000317.name: Facial myokymia
HP:0000317.definition: Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
HP:0000317.definition_cn: 面部肌纤维颤搐是由面神经（第七对颅神经）支配的一块或多块肌肉的细微纤维性活动。

HP:0000319.name: Smooth philtrum
HP:0000319.definition: Flat skin surface, with no ridge formation in the central region of the upper lip between the nasal base and upper vermilion border.
HP:0000319.definition_cn: 平坦的皮肤表面，上唇中央区域（位于鼻基底与上唇红缘之间）无嵴状结构形成。

HP:0000321.name: Square face
HP:0000321.definition: Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance.
HP:0000321.definition_cn: 从正面观察，面部轮廓显示上颌骨/颅骨及下颌骨/下颌体较宽，呈现方形外观。

HP:0000322.name: Short philtrum
HP:0000322.definition: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.
HP:0000322.definition_cn: 鼻基底与上唇中线红唇缘之间的距离低于平均值2个标准差以上。或者，鼻基底与上唇中线红唇缘之间的距离明显减小。

HP:0000324.name: Facial asymmetry
HP:0000324.definition: An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.
HP:0000324.definition_cn: 面部左右侧不对称异常。

HP:0000325.name: Triangular face
HP:0000325.definition: Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin.
HP:0000325.definition_cn: 正面观面部轮廓呈三角形，颞部宽阔，向下逐渐收窄至下颌尖。

HP:0000326.name: Abnormal maxilla morphology
HP:0000326.definition: An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone).

HP:0000327.name: Hypoplasia of the maxilla
HP:0000327.definition: Abnormally small dimension of the Maxilla. Usually creating a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or resulting in a deficient amount of projection of the base of the nose and lower midface region.
HP:0000327.definition_cn: 上颌骨发育不全。通常导致上下牙列之间的错颌畸形或错位，或引起鼻基底及中面部下份的突出度不足。

HP:0000329.name: Facial hemangioma
HP:0000329.definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.
HP:0000329.definition_cn: 血管瘤，一种血管内皮细胞的良性肿瘤，发生于面部。

HP:0000331.name: Short chin
HP:0000331.definition: Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.
HP:0000331.definition_cn: 下唇红缘至颏下点垂直距离缩短。

HP:0000336.name: Prominent supraorbital ridges
HP:0000336.definition: Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
HP:0000336.definition_cn: 额骨眶上部分的前向和/或侧向突出程度超过平均水平。

HP:0000337.name: Broad forehead
HP:0000337.definition: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead.
HP:0000337.definition_cn: 额部宽度或额颞间距超过平均值两个标准差以上（客观指标）；或额部两侧间距明显增加。

HP:0000338.name: Hypomimic face
HP:0000338.definition: A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.
HP:0000338.definition_cn: 面部皮下肌肉运动度降低，常伴有面部皱褶形成减少。

HP:0000339.name: Pugilistic facies
HP:0000339.definition: Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer.
HP:0000339.definition_cn: 面部特征粗犷，类似于拳击手面容。

HP:0000340.name: Sloping forehead
HP:0000340.definition: Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.
HP:0000340.definition_cn: 前额前表面相对于垂直面的倾斜度超过平均值两个标准差以上（客观标准）；或从侧面观察，前额后倾明显过度。

HP:0000341.name: Narrow forehead
HP:0000341.definition: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).
HP:0000341.definition_cn: 额部宽度或额颞间距低于平均值两个标准差以上（客观）；或颞区间明显狭窄（主观）。

HP:0000343.name: Long philtrum
HP:0000343.definition: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.
HP:0000343.definition_cn: 鼻基底与上唇中线红唇缘之间的距离超过平均值2个标准差。或者，鼻基底与上唇中线红唇缘之间的距离明显增加。

HP:0000346.name: Whistling appearance
HP:0000346.definition: An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.
HP:0000346.definition_cn: 面部形态异常，特征为口裂狭小及持续性唇部收缩，呈吹口哨状。

HP:0000348.name: High forehead
HP:0000348.definition: An abnormally increased height of the forehead.

HP:0000349.name: Widow's peak
HP:0000349.definition: Frontal hairline with bilateral arcs to a low point in the midline of the forehead.
HP:0000349.definition_cn: 额部发际线呈双侧弧形，于前额中线处形成低点。

HP:0000350.name: Small forehead
HP:0000350.definition: The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.

HP:0000356.name: Abnormality of the outer ear
HP:0000356.definition: An abnormality of the external ear.

HP:0000358.name: Posteriorly rotated ears
HP:0000358.definition: A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).
HP:0000358.definition_cn: 一种耳部位置异常的类型，其特征为耳部后旋（耳部上端向头后部旋转，耳部下端向头前部旋转）。

HP:0000359.name: Abnormality of the inner ear
HP:0000359.definition: An abnormality of the inner ear.

HP:0000360.name: Tinnitus
HP:0000360.definition: Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.
HP:0000360.definition_cn: 耳鸣是一种听觉感知，可描述为在无外部声学刺激的情况下，耳内或头部出现的声音体验。

HP:0000361.name: obsolete Pulsatile tinnitus (tympanic paraganglioma)
HP:0000361.name_cn: 陈旧性搏动性耳鸣（鼓室副神经节瘤）

HP:0000362.name: Otosclerosis
HP:0000362.definition: In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.
HP:0000362.definition_cn: 在耳硬化症中，骨痂在镫骨上积聚，导致部分固定。这限制了镫骨的运动，从而导致听力损失。

HP:0000363.name: Abnormal earlobe morphology
HP:0000363.definition: An abnormality of the lobule of pinna.

HP:0000364.name: Hearing abnormality
HP:0000364.definition: An abnormality of the sensory perception of sound.

HP:0000365.name: Hearing impairment
HP:0000365.definition: A decreased magnitude of the sensory perception of sound.

HP:0000369.name: Low-set ears
HP:0000369.definition: Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.
HP:0000369.definition_cn: 耳廓上缘插入点位于内眦间假想水平线下方，并向后延伸至耳部。

HP:0000370.name: Abnormality of the middle ear
HP:0000370.definition: An abnormality of the middle ear.

HP:0000371.name: Acute otitis media
HP:0000371.definition: Acute otitis media is a short and generally painful infection of the middle ear.
HP:0000371.definition_cn: 急性中耳炎是一种短暂且通常伴有疼痛的中耳感染。

HP:0000372.name: Abnormal auditory canal morphology
HP:0000372.definition: Any structural abnormality of the external acoustic tube (also known as the auditory canal).
HP:0000372.definition_cn: 外耳道（亦称听道）的任何结构异常。

HP:0000376.name: Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II
HP:0000376.definition: With incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation.
HP:0000376.name_cn: 耳蜗不完全分隔畸形II型
HP:0000376.definition_cn: 在不完全分隔II型中，耳蜗由1.5圈组成；耳蜗顶圈和中圈未分化，形成囊性顶端。前庭正常，而前庭导水管通常扩大。发育停滞发生在妊娠第七周。

HP:0000377.name: Abnormal pinna morphology
HP:0000377.definition: An abnormality of the pinna, which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.
HP:0000377.definition_cn: 耳廓畸形，亦称外耳畸形。

HP:0000378.name: Cupped ear
HP:0000378.definition: Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).
HP:0000378.definition_cn: 外耳横向突出，缺乏对耳轮折叠（包括上下脚缺失）。

HP:0000381.name: Stapes ankylosis
HP:0000381.definition: Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).
HP:0000381.definition_cn: 镫骨固定症（Stapes ankylosis）是指镫骨（中耳内呈马镫形的小骨或听小骨）的先天性或后天性固定，其与声音传导机制（外耳道、鼓膜和/或中耳听小骨）受损所导致的传导性听力损失相关。

HP:0000384.name: Preauricular skin tag
HP:0000384.definition: A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).
HP:0000384.definition_cn: 一种原始皮肤赘生物，常包含耳组织，其中央为软骨核心，位于耳廓（外耳部分）正前方。

HP:0000387.name: Absent earlobe
HP:0000387.definition: Absence of fleshy non-cartilaginous tissue inferior to the tragus and incisura.
HP:0000387.definition_cn: 耳屏和耳屏间切迹下方缺乏非软骨性软组织。

HP:0000388.name: Otitis media
HP:0000388.definition: Inflammation or infection of the middle ear.

HP:0000389.name: Chronic otitis media
HP:0000389.definition: Chronic otitis media refers to fluid, swelling, or infection of the middle ear that does not heal and may cause permanent damage to the ear.
HP:0000389.definition_cn: 慢性中耳炎是指中耳积液、肿胀或感染未能痊愈，并可能导致耳部永久性损伤的疾病。

HP:0000391.name: Thickened helices
HP:0000391.definition: Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.

HP:0000394.name: Lop ear
HP:0000394.definition: Anterior and inferior folding of the upper portion of the ear that obliterates triangular fossa and scapha.
HP:0000394.definition_cn: 耳廓上部前下折叠导致三角窝和耳舟消失。

HP:0000395.name: Prominent antihelix
HP:0000395.definition: The presence of an abnormally prominent antihelix.

HP:0000396.name: Overfolded helix
HP:0000396.definition: A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.
HP:0000396.definition_cn: 耳轮过度折叠症，即耳轮边缘过度卷曲，导致游离边缘与耳平面平行。

HP:0000399.name: Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment
HP:0000399.definition: A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.
HP:0000399.name_cn: 前语言性感音神经性听力障碍
HP:0000399.definition_cn: 一种感音神经性耳聋，其发病时间可为先天性或婴儿期，即在语言习得之前。

HP:0000400.name: Macrotia
HP:0000400.definition: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).
HP:0000400.definition_cn: 耳纵径中位数大于均值两个标准差以上且耳宽中位数大于均值两个标准差以上（客观）；或，耳廓长度和宽度明显增加（主观）。

HP:0000402.name: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
HP:0000402.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.

HP:0000403.name: Recurrent otitis media
HP:0000403.definition: Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.
HP:0000403.definition_cn: 中耳炎易感性增加，表现为反复发作的中耳炎。

HP:0000405.name: Conductive hearing impairment
HP:0000405.definition: An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.
HP:0000405.definition_cn: 声音传导至内耳的振动传导异常，导致声音感知感觉障碍。

HP:0000407.name: Sensorineural hearing impairment
HP:0000407.definition: A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.
HP:0000407.definition_cn: 一种与耳蜗神经功能异常相关的单侧或双侧听力障碍。

HP:0000408.name: Progressive sensorineural hearing impairment
HP:0000408.definition: A progressive form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
HP:0000408.name_cn: 进行性感音神经性听力损失
HP:0000408.definition_cn: 进行性感音神经性听力损失。

HP:0000410.name: Mixed hearing impairment
HP:0000410.definition: A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.
HP:0000410.definition_cn: 一种由传导性听力障碍和感音神经性听力障碍共同导致的听力损失类型。

HP:0000411.name: Protruding ear
HP:0000411.definition: Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).
HP:0000411.definition_cn: 耳平面与乳突骨形成的角度大于年龄的第97百分位数（客观）；或，耳轮外缘在最大距离点处距乳突超过2厘米（客观）。

HP:0000413.name: Atresia of the external auditory canal
HP:0000413.definition: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.
HP:0000413.definition_cn: 外耳道缺失或发育不全。

HP:0000414.name: Bulbous nose
HP:0000414.definition: Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose.
HP:0000414.definition_cn: 鼻前下部的体积增大和球形改变。

HP:0000415.name: Abnormal choanae morphology
HP:0000415.definition: Abnormality of the choanae (the posterior nasal apertures).
HP:0000415.definition_cn: 后鼻孔异常（鼻后孔异常）。

HP:0000418.name: Narrow nasal ridge
HP:0000418.definition: Decreased width of the nasal ridge.

HP:0000419.name: Abnormal nasal septum morphology
HP:0000419.definition: An abnormality of the nasal septum.

HP:0000420.name: Short nasal septum
HP:0000420.definition: Reduced superior to inferior length of the nasal septum.

HP:0000421.name: Epistaxis
HP:0000421.definition: Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.
HP:0000421.definition_cn: 鼻出血（Epistaxis）是指鼻腔内局部发生的出血现象。

HP:0000422.name: Abnormal nasal bridge morphology
HP:0000422.definition: Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.
HP:0000422.definition_cn: 鼻梁异常，即包括鼻根和鼻侧面的鞍形区域。该区域位于眉间与鼻骨下界之间，并向两侧延伸至内眦。

HP:0000426.name: Prominent nasal bridge
HP:0000426.definition: Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.
HP:0000426.definition_cn: 鼻根相对于同龄人常见位置的前移。

HP:0000429.name: Abnormal morphology of the nasal alae
HP:0000429.definition: An abnormality of the Ala of nose.

HP:0000430.name: Underdeveloped nasal alae
HP:0000430.definition: Thinned, deficient, or excessively arched ala nasi.
HP:0000430.definition_cn: 鼻翼变薄、缺损或过度拱起。

HP:0000431.name: Wide nasal bridge
HP:0000431.definition: Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).

HP:0000434.name: Nasal mucosa telangiectasia
HP:0000434.name_cn: 鼻黏膜毛细血管扩张症
HP:0000434.definition_cn: 鼻黏膜毛细血管扩张症。

HP:0000436.name: Abnormal nasal tip morphology
HP:0000436.definition: An abnormality of the nasal tip.

HP:0000437.name: Depressed nasal tip
HP:0000437.definition: Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base.
HP:0000437.definition_cn: 鼻尖至鼻基底距离缩短。

HP:0000444.name: Convex nasal ridge
HP:0000444.definition: Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.
HP:0000444.definition_cn: 鼻梁向前弯曲至连接鼻根与鼻尖的假想线。鼻部通常显得突出，且鼻小柱低平。

HP:0000445.name: Wide nose
HP:0000445.definition: Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.
HP:0000445.definition_cn: 鼻翼间距离超过年龄均值两个标准差以上，即鼻基底和鼻翼宽度明显增加。

HP:0000446.name: Narrow nasal bridge
HP:0000446.definition: Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.

HP:0000448.name: Prominent nose
HP:0000448.definition: Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.
HP:0000448.definition_cn: 鼻下点至鼻尖点的距离超过平均值两个标准差以上，或鼻尖前突明显增加。

HP:0000452.name: Choanal stenosis
HP:0000452.definition: Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).
HP:0000452.definition_cn: 后鼻孔异常狭窄（后鼻孔孔径异常缩小）。

HP:0000453.name: Choanal atresia
HP:0000453.definition: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture). Most embryologists believe that posterior choanal atresia results from a failure of rupture between the 35th and 38th day of fetal life of the partition which separates the bucconasal or buccopharyngeal membranes. The resultant choanal atresia may be unilateral or bilateral, bony or membranous, complete or incomplete. In over 90 per cent of cases the obstruction is bony, while in the remainder it is membranous. The bony type of atresia is commonly located 1-2 mm. anterior to the posterior edge of the hard palate, and the osseous septum varies in thickness from 1 to 10 mm. In the membranous form of choanal atresia the obstruction usually occurs further posteriorly. In approximately one third of cases the atresia is bilateral.
HP:0000453.definition_cn: 后鼻孔闭锁或异常闭合（后鼻孔为鼻腔后部开口）。大多数胚胎学家认为，后鼻孔闭锁是由于胎儿发育第35至38天期间，分隔口鼻膜或口咽膜的隔膜未能破裂所致。由此产生的后鼻孔闭锁可为单侧或双侧、骨性或膜性、完全或不完全。超过90%的病例为骨性闭锁，其余为膜性闭锁。骨性闭锁通常位于硬腭后缘前方1-2毫米处，骨性隔板的厚度从1到10毫米不等。在膜性后鼻孔闭锁中，阻塞通常发生在更靠后的位置。约三分之一的病例为双侧闭锁。

HP:0000455.name: Broad nasal tip
HP:0000455.definition: Increase in width of the nasal tip.

HP:0000456.name: Bifid nasal tip
HP:0000456.definition: A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.
HP:0000456.definition_cn: 鼻尖分裂。视觉上可评估的鼻尖垂直凹陷、裂隙或凹陷。

HP:0000457.name: Depressed nasal ridge
HP:0000457.definition: Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.
HP:0000457.definition_cn: 鼻梁后置导致的鼻部突出度不足。

HP:0000458.name: Anosmia
HP:0000458.definition: An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.
HP:0000458.definition_cn: 嗅觉丧失。这是一个通用术语，描述在嗅觉过程中任何部分出现无法感知气味的情况，包括气味分子被鼻黏膜吸收、扩散至纤毛、与嗅觉受体位点结合、嗅觉神经元产生动作电位以及感知气味的整个过程。

HP:0000460.name: Narrow nose
HP:0000460.definition: Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.
HP:0000460.definition_cn: 鼻翼间距离低于同年龄组平均值2个标准差以上，或表现为鼻基底和鼻翼宽度明显减小。

HP:0000463.name: Anteverted nares
HP:0000463.definition: Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).
HP:0000463.definition_cn: 在法兰克福水平位下观察头部，且观察者的眼睛与被观察者的眼睛处于同一水平线时，可见前向的鼻孔。此视角下呈现出鼻尖上翘的外观（上翘鼻尖）。

HP:0000465.name: Webbed neck
HP:0000465.definition: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.
HP:0000465.definition_cn: 翼状颈皮是一种先天性皮肤皱褶，沿颈部两侧延伸至肩部。其涉及位于斜方肌浅层的异位纤维化面部带。同时存在过多的带毛皮肤，并向下延伸至颈部区域，远远超出正常发际线。

HP:0000467.name: Neck muscle weakness
HP:0000467.definition: Decreased strength of the neck musculature.

HP:0000468.name: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
HP:0000468.definition: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.
HP:0000468.name_cn: 颈部周围脂肪组织增多
HP:0000468.definition_cn: 颈部皮下脂肪组织增多。

HP:0000471.name: Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia
HP:0000471.definition: Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract.
HP:0000471.definition_cn: 影响胃肠道脉管系统的发育不良。

HP:0000472.name: Long neck
HP:0000472.definition: Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.

HP:0000473.name: Torticollis
HP:0000473.definition: Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.
HP:0000473.definition_cn: 颈部肌肉不自主收缩导致头部姿势异常或运动异常。

HP:0000474.name: Thickened nuchal skin fold
HP:0000474.definition: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold (NF) measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. An NF measurement greater than 5 mm at 14 to 17+6 weeks of gestation, or 6 mm at 18 to 28 weeks has been associated with a markedly increased risk for Down syndrome.
HP:0000474.definition_cn: 胎儿颈部后部皮肤厚度增厚。颈项透明层（NF）测量是在胎儿头部的横切面上，在透明隔腔和丘脑水平处，向后倾斜以包括小脑。测量从枕骨外缘到中线处皮肤外缘的距离。妊娠14至17+6周时NF测量值大于5毫米，或18至28周时大于6毫米，与唐氏综合征风险显著增加相关。

HP:0000475.name: Broad neck
HP:0000475.definition: Increased side-to-side width of the neck.

HP:0000476.name: Cystic hygroma
HP:0000476.definition: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.

HP:0000478.name: Abnormality of the eye
HP:0000478.definition: Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.
HP:0000478.definition_cn: 任何眼部异常，包括位置异常、间距异常以及眼内异常。

HP:0000479.name: Abnormal retinal morphology
HP:0000479.definition: A structural abnormality of the retina.

HP:0000480.name: Retinal coloboma
HP:0000480.definition: A notch or cleft of the retina.
HP:0000480.definition_cn: 视网膜切迹或视网膜裂。

HP:0000481.name: Abnormal cornea morphology
HP:0000481.definition: Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.
HP:0000481.definition_cn: 角膜异常，即覆盖虹膜、瞳孔和前房的眼前部透明组织的任何异常。

HP:0000482.name: Microcornea
HP:0000482.definition: A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.
HP:0000482.definition_cn: 先天性角膜异常，表现为角膜及眼前节较正常者小。即使在成年期，角膜水平直径亦未达到10毫米。

HP:0000483.name: Astigmatism
HP:0000483.definition: A type of refraction error associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea.
HP:0000483.definition_cn: 一种与角膜前表面和/或后表面异常曲率相关的屈光不正类型。

HP:0000484.name: Hyperopic astigmatism
HP:0000484.definition: A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.
HP:0000484.definition_cn: 一种散光形式，其中一个子午线为远视，而与其成直角的子午线无屈光不正。

HP:0000485.name: Megalocornea
HP:0000485.definition: An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.
HP:0000485.definition_cn: 角膜扩大伴正常透明度和功能。巨角膜的诊断标准为出生时水平角膜直径≥12毫米，或两岁后水平角膜直径≥13毫米。

HP:0000486.name: Strabismus
HP:0000486.definition: A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.
HP:0000486.definition_cn: 眼位偏斜导致视觉轴偏离双眼黄斑中心凹注视。斜视的分类可基于多种特征，包括眼球的相对位置、偏斜是隐性还是显性、间歇性还是持续性、共同性还是非共同性，以及根据发病年龄和任何相关屈光不正的相关性。

HP:0000488.name: Retinopathy
HP:0000488.definition: Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.
HP:0000488.definition_cn: 视网膜的任何非炎症性疾病。由于该非特异性术语在文献中广泛使用，因此在此保留，但如果可能，新的注释应指明视网膜异常的确切类型。

HP:0000489.name: obsolete Abnormality of globe location or size

HP:0000490.name: Deeply set eye
HP:0000490.definition: An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.

HP:0000493.name: Abnormal foveal morphology
HP:0000493.definition: An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.
HP:0000493.definition_cn: 中央凹异常，即黄斑中央区域的异常，该区域负责中央高分辨率视觉，并含有视网膜中最大密度的视锥细胞。

HP:0000494.name: Downslanted palpebral fissures
HP:0000494.definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.
HP:0000494.definition_cn: 睑裂倾斜度低于平均值两个标准差以上。

HP:0000495.name: Recurrent corneal erosions
HP:0000495.definition: The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.
HP:0000495.definition_cn: 复发性角膜上皮糜烂的存在。尽管大多数角膜上皮缺损愈合迅速，但部分病例可能出现复发性溃疡。

HP:0000496.name: Abnormality of eye movement
HP:0000496.definition: An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.
HP:0000496.definition_cn: 眼球运动或控制异常，包括自主或非自主性眼球运动障碍。

HP:0000497.name: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction

HP:0000501.name: Glaucoma
HP:0000501.definition: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.
HP:0000501.definition_cn: 青光眼是指视网膜神经节细胞在特征性视神经病变模式下的丧失，通常与眼内压升高相关。

HP:0000503.name: Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels
HP:0000503.definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.

HP:0000504.name: Abnormality of vision
HP:0000504.definition_cn: 视力异常（视觉感知障碍）。

HP:0000505.name: Visual impairment
HP:0000505.definition: Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.
HP:0000505.definition_cn: 视觉障碍（或视力损害）是指由于疾病、创伤、先天性或退行性病变导致的视觉功能显著受限，且无法通过常规手段（如屈光矫正、药物治疗或手术）进行矫正，从而需要额外支持的一种视力丧失状态。

HP:0000506.name: Telecanthus
HP:0000506.definition: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.
HP:0000506.definition_cn: 内眦间距超过均值两个标准差以上（客观）；或，内眦间距明显增加。

HP:0000508.name: Ptosis
HP:0000508.definition: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).
HP:0000508.definition_cn: 上睑缘位置较正常低3毫米或以上，覆盖虹膜上部（客观）；或上睑缘遮挡瞳孔至少部分区域（主观）。

HP:0000510.name: Rod-cone dystrophy
HP:0000510.definition: An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.
HP:0000510.name_cn: 视杆视锥细胞营养不良
HP:0000510.definition_cn: 一种遗传性视网膜疾病亚型，其中视杆细胞似乎比视锥细胞受到更严重的影响。典型表现为夜盲症（由于视杆细胞功能障碍），随后出现中周视野丧失，逐渐扩展并导致许多患者仅保留黄斑视锥细胞而形成中央小岛状视野。

HP:0000511.name: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
HP:0000511.definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
HP:0000511.name_cn: 垂直性核上性凝视麻痹
HP:0000511.definition_cn: 核上性凝视麻痹是由于大脑损伤导致的垂直方向注视能力丧失。患者自主眼球运动功能受损，但由于脑干功能完好，所有反射性共轭眼球运动均正常。

HP:0000512.name: Abnormal electroretinogram
HP:0000512.definition: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.
HP:0000512.definition_cn: 视网膜电图检测中各种细胞类型电反应异常。

HP:0000514.name: Slow saccadic eye movements
HP:0000514.definition: An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.
HP:0000514.definition_cn: 眼球扫视运动速度异常缓慢。

HP:0000518.name: Cataract
HP:0000518.definition: A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule.
HP:0000518.definition_cn: 白内障是指晶状体或其囊膜发生混浊或云状变化的病症。

HP:0000519.name: Developmental cataract
HP:0000519.definition: A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.
HP:0000519.definition_cn: 先天性白内障，由于发育缺陷所致，与大多数因晶状体退行性变而发生于成年期的白内障不同。

HP:0000520.name: Proptosis
HP:0000520.definition: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.
HP:0000520.definition_cn: 眼球突出（Exophthalmos）是指眼球向前突出超过面部平面正常范围的一种临床表现。

HP:0000523.name: Subcapsular cataract
HP:0000523.definition: A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens.

HP:0000524.name: Conjunctival telangiectasia
HP:0000524.definition: The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.
HP:0000524.definition_cn: 结膜黏膜表面附近存在直径约0.5-1.0毫米的扩张血管。

HP:0000525.name: Abnormality iris morphology
HP:0000525.definition: An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.
HP:0000525.definition_cn: 虹膜异常，虹膜是位于角膜和晶状体之间的色素性肌肉组织，其中心有一开口称为瞳孔。

HP:0000526.name: Aniridia
HP:0000526.definition: Abnormality of the iris characterized by, typically bilateral, complete or partial iris hypoplasia. The phenotype ranges from mild defects of anterior iris stroma only to almost complete absence of the iris.
HP:0000526.definition_cn: 虹膜异常，特征为通常双侧的完全或部分虹膜发育不全。表型范围从前部虹膜基质轻度缺陷到几乎完全缺失虹膜。

HP:0000527.name: Long eyelashes
HP:0000527.definition: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).
HP:0000527.definition_cn: 上眼睑中部睫毛长度>10毫米或睫毛长度增加（主观判断）。

HP:0000528.name: Anophthalmia
HP:0000528.definition: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

HP:0000529.name: Progressive visual loss
HP:0000529.definition: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.
