HP:0001597.definition: Abnormal structure or appearance of the nail.

HP:0001598.name: Concave nail
HP:0001598.definition: The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.
HP:0001598.definition_cn: 自然纵向（后远端）凸弓缺失或反转。

HP:0001601.name: Laryngomalacia
HP:0001601.definition: Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.
HP:0001601.definition_cn: 喉软化症是一种先天性喉软骨异常，表现为软骨松弛并在吸气时塌陷覆盖喉部。

HP:0001602.name: Laryngeal stenosis
HP:0001602.definition: Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.
HP:0001602.definition_cn: 喉部狭窄或缩窄，其症状可能与呼吸困难相关，具体取决于喉部狭窄的程度。

HP:0001604.name: Vocal cord paresis
HP:0001604.definition: Decreased strength of the vocal folds.

HP:0001605.name: Vocal cord paralysis
HP:0001605.definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds.

HP:0001606.name: obsolete Vocal cord paralysis (caused by tumor impingement)
HP:0001606.name_cn: 陈旧性声带麻痹（由肿瘤压迫所致）

HP:0001609.name: Hoarse voice
HP:0001609.definition: Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.
HP:0001609.definition_cn: 声音嘶哑（Hoarseness）是指音调或音质的改变，表现为声音微弱、气息声明显、粗糙或沙哑。

HP:0001611.name: Hypernasal speech
HP:0001611.definition: A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech associated with structural abnormality of the nasal passages.
HP:0001611.definition_cn: 一种以鼻气流异常增加为特征的言语障碍，通常与鼻腔结构异常相关。

HP:0001613.name: obsolete Hoarse voice (caused by tumor impingement)
HP:0001613.name_cn: 陈旧性声嘶（由肿瘤压迫所致）

HP:0001618.name: Dysphonia
HP:0001618.definition: Difficulty in speaking due to a physical disorder of the mouth, tongue, throat, or vocal cords. Associated with a known physical or neurological cause.
HP:0001618.definition_cn: Dysarthria secondary to structural or neurological impairment of the oral cavity, tongue, pharynx, or vocal cords. Etiologically linked to identifiable organic or neurological pathology.

HP:0001620.name: Abnormally high-pitched voice
HP:0001620.definition: A persistent (minutes to hours) abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice for the context or social situation or significantly different from baseline of the individual.
HP:0001620.name_cn: 声音异常高亢（Dysphonia with abnormally high pitch）
HP:0001620.definition_cn: 持续性（数分钟至数小时）的异常音调（频率）升高，与语境或社交情境不符，或显著偏离个体的基线水平。

HP:0001622.name: Premature birth
HP:0001622.definition: The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.
HP:0001622.definition_cn: 妊娠不足37周的新生儿出生。

HP:0001623.name: Breech presentation
HP:0001623.definition: A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.

HP:0001626.name: Abnormality of the cardiovascular system
HP:0001626.definition: Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system.

HP:0001627.name: Abnormal heart morphology
HP:0001627.definition: Any structural anomaly of the heart.

HP:0001629.name: Ventricular septal defect
HP:0001629.definition: A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.
HP:0001629.definition_cn: 位于心脏底部两个腔室（心室）之间的孔洞。该缺损位于室间隔的最上端。

HP:0001631.name: Atrial septal defect
HP:0001631.definition: Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.
HP:0001631.definition_cn: 房间隔缺损（Atrial Septal Defect, ASD）是一种先天性房间隔异常，使得血液能够通过房间隔在左心房和右心房之间流动。

HP:0001633.name: Abnormal mitral valve morphology
HP:0001633.definition: Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.

HP:0001634.name: Mitral valve prolapse
HP:0001634.definition: One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.
HP:0001634.definition_cn: 二尖瓣的一个或两个瓣叶（瓣膜）在左心室收缩时向后凸入左心房。

HP:0001635.name: Congestive heart failure
HP:0001635.definition: The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.
HP:0001635.definition_cn: 心脏功能异常的存在，导致心脏无法以与组织需求相匹配的速率泵血，或需要异常升高的充盈压力才能实现泵血的状态。心力衰竭通常与心肌收缩功能缺陷相关。

HP:0001636.name: Tetralogy of Fallot
HP:0001636.definition: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.
HP:0001636.definition_cn: 一种先天性心脏畸形，包括肺动脉狭窄、主动脉骑跨、室间隔缺损和右心室肥厚。若上述四种特征中至少存在三种，即可诊断为法洛四联症（Tetralogy of Fallot, TOF）。

HP:0001637.name: Abnormal myocardium morphology
HP:0001637.definition: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall.

HP:0001638.name: Cardiomyopathy
HP:0001638.definition: A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.
HP:0001638.definition_cn: 一种心肌疾病，其中心肌在结构和功能上异常，且不存在足以导致所观察到的心肌异常的冠状动脉疾病、高血压、瓣膜疾病和先天性心脏病。

HP:0001639.name: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
HP:0001639.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.
HP:0001639.definition_cn: 肥厚型心肌病（Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy, HCM）的定义是在缺乏足以引起所观察到的异常的后负荷条件（如高血压、瓣膜疾病）的情况下，心室壁厚度或质量增加。

HP:0001640.name: Cardiomegaly
HP:0001640.definition: Increased size of the heart, clinically defined as an increased transverse diameter of the cardiac silhouette that is greater than or equal to 50% of the transverse diameter of the chest (increased cardiothoracic ratio) on a posterior-anterior projection of a chest radiograph or a computed tomography.
HP:0001640.definition_cn: 心脏增大，临床定义为在胸部后前位X线片或计算机断层扫描上，心脏轮廓的横径大于或等于胸部横径的50%（心胸比增大）。

HP:0001641.name: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
HP:0001641.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

HP:0001642.name: Pulmonic stenosis
HP:0001642.definition: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis), below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis), or above the pulmonary valve (supravalvar stenosis).
HP:0001642.definition_cn: 右心室流出道狭窄可发生于肺动脉瓣（瓣膜性狭窄）、肺动脉瓣下方（漏斗部狭窄）或肺动脉瓣上方（瓣上狭窄）。

HP:0001643.name: Patent ductus arteriosus
HP:0001643.definition: In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.
HP:0001643.definition_cn: 在子宫内，动脉导管（Ductus Arteriosus, DA）通过连接主肺动脉与降主动脉，将心室输出从肺部转向胎盘。在出生后的前3天内，动脉导管未闭（Patent Ductus Arteriosus, PDA）是健康足月和早产新生儿的生理性分流，通常在出生后约24小时内基本关闭，并在约三周后完全关闭。生理性关闭失败称为持续性或未闭动脉导管（PDA）。根据左向右分流的程度，PDA可能产生临床后果。

HP:0001644.name: Dilated cardiomyopathy
HP:0001644.definition: Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.
HP:0001644.definition_cn: 扩张型心肌病（Dilated Cardiomyopathy, DCM）的定义为在不存在异常负荷条件（如高血压、瓣膜病）或足以导致整体收缩功能受损的冠状动脉疾病的情况下，出现左心室扩张和左心室收缩功能障碍。右心室扩张和功能障碍可能存在，但并非诊断的必要条件。

HP:0001645.name: Sudden cardiac death
HP:0001645.definition: The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).
HP:0001645.definition_cn: 心脏骤停（Sudden Cardiac Arrest, SCA）导致在短时间内（通常在症状出现后1小时内）死亡。

HP:0001646.name: Abnormal aortic valve morphology
HP:0001646.definition: Any abnormality of the aortic valve.

HP:0001647.name: Bicuspid aortic valve
HP:0001647.definition: The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps). Bicuspid aortic valvue is a malformation of a commissure (small space between the attachment of each cusp to the aortic wall) and the adjacent parts of the two corresponding cusps forming a raphe (the fused area of the two underdeveloped cusps turning into a malformed commissure between both cusps; the raphe is a fibrous ridge that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps).
HP:0001647.definition_cn: 主动脉瓣存在两个瓣叶而非正常的三个瓣叶（瓣膜）。二叶式主动脉瓣是一种连合部（每个瓣叶附着于主动脉壁之间的小间隙）及相邻两个相应瓣叶部分形成融合线（两个发育不全的瓣叶融合区域转变为两个瓣叶之间的畸形连合部；融合线是从连合部延伸至两个发育不全、联合瓣叶游离缘的纤维性嵴）的畸形。

HP:0001648.name: Cor pulmonale
HP:0001648.definition: Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.
HP:0001648.definition_cn: 由肺动脉和右心室慢性高血压引起的右心衰竭。

HP:0001649.name: Tachycardia
HP:0001649.definition: A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age.
HP:0001649.definition_cn: 心动过速（Tachycardia），即心率超过该年龄段的正常静息心率范围。

HP:0001650.name: Aortic valve stenosis
HP:0001650.definition: The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.
HP:0001650.definition_cn: 主动脉瓣狭窄（aortic valve stenosis）的存在。

HP:0001651.name: Dextrocardia
HP:0001651.definition: The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or \\
HP:0001651.definition_cn: 心脏位于右侧胸腔内，即存在左右反转（或称为内脏反位）。

HP:0001653.name: Mitral regurgitation
HP:0001653.definition: An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.
HP:0001653.definition_cn: 二尖瓣异常，其特征为二尖瓣关闭不全或功能不全，导致心室收缩时血液通过二尖瓣反流。

HP:0001654.name: Abnormal heart valve morphology
HP:0001654.definition: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.

HP:0001655.name: Patent foramen ovale
HP:0001655.definition: Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.
HP:0001655.definition_cn: 卵圆孔未闭，导致左心房与右心房之间存在潜在通道。

HP:0001657.name: Prolonged QT interval
HP:0001657.definition: Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).
HP:0001657.definition_cn: Q波起始至T波结束时间延长，通过心电图（EKG）测量。

HP:0001658.name: Myocardial infarction
HP:0001658.definition: Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.
HP:0001658.definition_cn: 心肌坏死，由心脏血液供应阻塞引起，常伴有胸痛、呼吸困难、心悸和焦虑，以及特征性心电图表现和血清标志物升高，包括肌酸激酶-MB同工酶和肌钙蛋白。

HP:0001659.name: Aortic regurgitation
HP:0001659.definition: An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.
HP:0001659.definition_cn: 主动脉瓣关闭不全，导致血液从主动脉反流至左心室。

HP:0001660.name: Truncus arteriosus
HP:0001660.definition: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.
HP:0001660.definition_cn: 单一动脉干起源于心脏团块。肺动脉、主动脉和冠状动脉均由此单一动脉干发出，未见其他流出道。

HP:0001662.name: Bradycardia
HP:0001662.definition: A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).
HP:0001662.definition_cn: 心动过缓（成人，心率低于每分钟60次）。

HP:0001663.name: Ventricular fibrillation
HP:0001663.definition: Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.
HP:0001663.definition_cn: 左心室肌纤维不受控制的收缩未能产生左心室的收缩。心室颤动通常始于心室期前收缩和短暂的快速室性心动过速，进而恶化为不协调的心室颤动。

HP:0001664.name: Torsade de pointes
HP:0001664.definition: A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.
HP:0001664.name_cn: 尖端扭转型室性心动过速
HP:0001664.definition_cn: 一种室性心动过速，其特征为多形性QRS波群，其振幅和周期长度发生变化，因此在心电图上呈现出围绕基线振荡的外观。

HP:0001667.name: Right ventricular hypertrophy
HP:0001667.definition: In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.
HP:0001667.definition_cn: 在本病例中，右心室肌壁较正常增厚，导致前后位胸部X线片上出现特征性的靴形心（coeur-en-sabot）外观。右心室肥厚通常与任何形式的右心室流出道梗阻或肺动脉高压相关，而后者可能源于左心疾病。超声心动图表现为右心室前壁及室间隔增厚。心室腔大小通常正常或轻度扩大。在许多病例中，由于三尖瓣反流的存在，常伴有容量负荷过重；若无三尖瓣反流，室间隔运动则正常。

HP:0001669.name: Transposition of the great arteries
HP:0001669.definition: A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.
HP:0001669.definition_cn: 一种复杂的先天性心脏畸形，其中主动脉起源于形态学右心室，而肺动脉起源于形态学左心室。

HP:0001670.name: Asymmetric septal hypertrophy
HP:0001670.definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.
HP:0001670.definition_cn: 肥厚型心肌病，表现为不对称性肥厚，以室间隔肥厚为主，并伴有心肌细胞排列紊乱。

HP:0001671.name: Abnormal cardiac septum morphology
HP:0001671.definition: An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

HP:0001673.name: obsolete Tachycardia (with pheochromocytoma)
HP:0001673.name_cn: 过时术语：心动过速（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）

HP:0001674.name: Complete atrioventricular canal defect
HP:0001674.definition: A congenital heart defect characterized by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.
HP:0001674.definition_cn: 一种先天性心脏缺陷，其特征为特定组合的心脏畸形，包括共同房室瓣、原发孔型房间隔缺损和流入道型室间隔缺损。

HP:0001675.name: obsolete Rhythm disturbances associated with pheochromocytoma
HP:0001675.name_cn: 与嗜铬细胞瘤相关的心律失常

HP:0001676.name: obsolete Palpitations (with pheochromocytoma)
HP:0001676.name_cn: 陈旧性心悸（伴嗜铬细胞瘤）

HP:0001677.name: Coronary artery atherosclerosis
HP:0001677.definition: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.
HP:0001677.definition_cn: 冠状动脉壁内粥样斑块积聚导致冠状动脉直径缩小，从而增加心肌缺血的风险。

HP:0001678.name: Atrioventricular block
HP:0001678.definition: Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.
HP:0001678.definition_cn: 心房去极化通过房室结传导至心室的延迟或缺失。

HP:0001680.name: Coarctation of aorta
HP:0001680.definition: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.
HP:0001680.definition_cn: 主动脉缩窄是指主动脉某一段的狭窄或缩窄。

HP:0001681.name: Angina pectoris
HP:0001681.definition: Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.
HP:0001681.definition_cn: 劳力性或应激性诱发的阵发性胸痛，与心肌缺血相关。

HP:0001682.name: Subvalvular aortic stenosis
HP:0001682.definition: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.
HP:0001682.definition_cn: 左心室流出道血流固定性梗阻，与主动脉瓣水平以下的狭窄（变窄）相关。

HP:0001683.name: Ectopia cordis
HP:0001683.definition: Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.
HP:0001683.definition_cn: 先天性腹壁畸形伴心脏部分或全部经腹壁缺损处脱出胸腔外。

HP:0001684.name: Secundum atrial septal defect
HP:0001684.definition: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.
HP:0001684.definition_cn: 一种由卵圆孔扩大、继发隔发育不全或原发隔过度吸收引起的心房间隔缺损。

HP:0001685.name: Myocardial fibrosis
HP:0001685.definition: Myocardial fibrosis is characterized by dysregulated collagen turnover (increased synthesis predominates over unchanged or decreased degradation) and excessive diffuse collagen accumulation in the interstitial and perivascular spaces as well as by phenotypically transformed fibroblasts, termed myofibroblasts.
HP:0001685.definition_cn: 心肌纤维化的特征包括胶原代谢失调（合成增加占主导，而降解不变或减少）、间质和血管周围空间弥漫性胶原过度积累，以及表型转化的成纤维细胞，称为肌成纤维细胞。

HP:0001688.name: Sinus bradycardia
HP:0001688.definition: Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.
HP:0001688.definition_cn: 与平均静息窦性心率低于每分钟50次相关的心动过缓。

HP:0001691.name: Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis
HP:0001691.definition: A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow through the left-ventricular outflow tract.
HP:0001691.definition_cn: 一种由室间隔肌层增厚引起的主动脉瓣下狭窄，导致左心室流出道血流受阻。

HP:0001692.name: Atrial arrhythmia
HP:0001692.definition: A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.
HP:0001692.definition_cn: 一种以心房为主要电生理紊乱部位的室上性心动过速。

HP:0001693.name: Cardiac shunt
HP:0001693.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.
HP:0001693.definition_cn: 心脏血流模式偏离循环系统正常回路。

HP:0001694.name: Right-to-left shunt
HP:0001694.definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.
HP:0001694.definition_cn: 心脏内血流模式异常，即从心脏右侧到左侧的循环系统正常通路发生偏离。

HP:0001695.name: Cardiac arrest
HP:0001695.definition: An abrupt loss of heart function.

HP:0001696.name: Situs inversus totalis
HP:0001696.definition: A left-right reversal (or mirror reflection) of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.
HP:0001696.definition_cn: 主要胸腹部器官解剖位置的左右反转（或镜像反射）。

HP:0001697.name: Abnormal pericardium morphology
HP:0001697.definition: An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.
HP:0001697.definition_cn: 心包异常，即围绕心脏及主动脉、腔静脉和肺动脉近端充满液体的囊状结构异常。

HP:0001698.name: Pericardial effusion
HP:0001698.definition: Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.

HP:0001700.name: Myocardial necrosis
HP:0001700.definition: Irreversible damage to heart tissue (myocardium) due to lack of oxygen after a heart attack (myocardial infarction).
HP:0001700.definition_cn: 心肌梗死（myocardial infarction）后因缺氧导致心肌组织（myocardium）发生不可逆性损伤。

HP:0001701.name: Pericarditis
HP:0001701.definition: Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).

HP:0001702.name: Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology
HP:0001702.definition: Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.

HP:0001704.name: Tricuspid valve prolapse
HP:0001704.definition: One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.
HP:0001704.definition_cn: 三尖瓣的一个或多个瓣叶（瓣尖）在右心室收缩时凸入右心房。

HP:0001705.name: Right ventricular outlet tract obstruction
HP:0001705.definition: An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.
HP:0001705.definition_cn: 右心室流出道血流前向性梗阻。

HP:0001706.name: Endocardial fibroelastosis
HP:0001706.definition: Diffuse thickening of the ventricular endocardium and by associated myocardial dysfunction
HP:0001706.name_cn: 心内膜纤维弹性组织增生症
HP:0001706.definition_cn: 心室心内膜弥漫性增厚伴相关心肌功能障碍

HP:0001707.name: Abnormal right ventricle morphology
HP:0001707.definition: An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.

HP:0001708.name: Right ventricular failure
HP:0001708.definition: Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading to pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.
HP:0001708.definition_cn: 右心室功能减退（即接收来自右心房的血液并将血液射入肺动脉的能力下降），常导致凹陷性外周水肿、腹水和肝肿大。

HP:0001709.name: Third degree atrioventricular block
HP:0001709.definition: Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.
HP:0001709.definition_cn: 三度房室传导阻滞（亦称完全性心脏传导阻滞）是指心房与心室之间的完全性电活动分离。当P波数量多于QRS波群且两者之间无任何关联（无传导）时，即可诊断为三度房室传导阻滞。

HP:0001710.name: Conotruncal defect
HP:0001710.definition: A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.
HP:0001710.definition_cn: 心脏流出道先天性畸形。圆锥动脉干畸形被认为是由胚胎心脏流出道发育异常所致，包括永存动脉干、法洛四联症、主动脉弓中断、大动脉转位和右心室双出口。

HP:0001711.name: Abnormal left ventricle morphology
HP:0001711.definition: Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.

HP:0001712.name: Left ventricular hypertrophy
HP:0001712.definition: Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle.
HP:0001712.definition_cn: 左心室肥大（Left Ventricular Hypertrophy, LVH）

HP:0001713.name: Abnormal cardiac ventricle morphology
HP:0001713.definition: An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

HP:0001714.name: Ventricular hypertrophy
HP:0001714.definition: Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.
HP:0001714.definition_cn: 心室肌组织肥大伴心室壁厚度增加及弹性丧失。临床上将心室肥厚区分为左心室肥厚和右心室肥厚。

HP:0001716.name: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome
HP:0001716.definition: A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.
HP:0001716.definition_cn: 一种心脏传导系统疾病，其特征是由于存在异常的房室附加电传导通路而导致心室预激。

HP:0001717.name: Coronary artery calcification
HP:0001717.definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.
HP:0001717.definition_cn: 冠状动脉壁内膜或中膜层中钙和磷酸盐的沉积，伴随矿物质沉积。

HP:0001718.name: Mitral stenosis
HP:0001718.definition: An abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.

HP:0001719.name: Double outlet right ventricle
HP:0001719.definition: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.
HP:0001719.definition_cn: 双出口右心室（Double Outlet Right Ventricle, DORV）是一种心室-动脉连接异常，其中两大血管完全或主要起源于右心室。

HP:0001722.name: High-output congestive heart failure
HP:0001722.definition: A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.
HP:0001722.name_cn: 高输出性充血性心力衰竭
HP:0001722.definition_cn: 一种以心输出量升高为特征的心力衰竭形式。这种情况可见于心力衰竭合并甲状腺功能亢进、贫血、妊娠、动静脉瘘等患者。

HP:0001723.name: Restrictive cardiomyopathy
HP:0001723.definition: Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness.
HP:0001723.definition_cn: 限制性左心室生理学特征表现为心室充盈模式，其中心肌硬度增加导致心室压力在仅少量容积增加时急剧上升，定义为在正常或减低的舒张容积（一个或两个心室）、正常或减低的收缩容积以及正常心室壁厚度的情况下出现的限制性心室生理学。

HP:0001726.name: obsolete Increased prevalence of valvular disease
HP:0001726.name_cn: 过时的 瓣膜疾病患病率增加

HP:0001727.name: Thromboembolic stroke
HP:0001727.definition: A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.
HP:0001727.definition_cn: 由于血栓栓塞引起的脑血管意外（中风）。

HP:0001730.name: Progressive hearing impairment
HP:0001730.definition: A progressive form of hearing impairment.

HP:0001733.name: Pancreatitis
HP:0001733.definition: The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

HP:0001734.name: Annular pancreas
HP:0001734.definition: A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.
HP:0001734.definition_cn: 一种先天性异常，其中胰腺完全（或有时不完全）环绕十二指肠的第二部分，偶尔会阻塞更近端的十二指肠。

HP:0001737.name: Pancreatic cysts
HP:0001737.definition: A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.

HP:0001738.name: Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
HP:0001738.definition: Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.
HP:0001738.definition_cn: 外分泌胰腺功能受损，由于消化酶缺乏导致食物消化能力下降。

HP:0001739.name: Abnormal nasopharynx morphology
HP:0001739.definition: A structural anomaly of the nasopharynx.

HP:0001741.name: Phimosis
HP:0001741.definition: The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.
HP:0001741.definition_cn: 男性包皮无法完全从阴茎头部回缩。

HP:0001742.name: Nasal congestion
HP:0001742.definition: Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.
HP:0001742.definition_cn: 鼻腔通气功能减退常导致口呼吸。

HP:0001744.name: Splenomegaly
HP:0001744.definition: Abnormal increased size of the spleen.

HP:0001746.name: Asplenia
HP:0001746.definition_cn: 脾脏缺失（脾脏发育不全）。

HP:0001747.name: Accessory spleen
HP:0001747.definition: An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.
HP:0001747.definition_cn: 副脾是一种圆形、等回声、均质且结构光滑的解剖变异，通常位于脾脏内侧轮廓、脾门附近或下极周围。其无病理学意义。

HP:0001748.name: Polysplenia
HP:0001748.definition: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.
HP:0001748.definition_cn: 多脾症是一种先天性病变，表现为多个小型副脾。

HP:0001750.name: Single ventricle
HP:0001750.definition: The presence of only one working lower chamber in the heart, usually with a virtual absence of the ventricular septum and usually present in conjunction with double inlet left or right ventricle.
HP:0001750.definition_cn: 单心室畸形，通常伴有室间隔的几乎完全缺失，且常与双入口左心室或双入口右心室并存。

HP:0001751.name: Abnormal vestibular function
HP:0001751.definition: An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

HP:0001756.name: Vestibular hyporeflexia
HP:0001756.definition: A general descriptive term that describes impaired functioning of the vestibular apparatus that leads to manifestations such as dizziness or postural imbalance
HP:0001756.definition_cn: 前庭功能障碍的通用描述性术语，指前庭器官功能受损，导致诸如眩晕或姿势失衡等临床表现。

HP:0001757.name: High-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
HP:0001757.definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the higher frequencies.
HP:0001757.name_cn: 高频感音神经性听力损失
HP:0001757.definition_cn: 一种主要影响高频的感音神经性听力损失。

HP:0001760.name: Abnormal foot morphology
HP:0001760.definition: An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.

HP:0001761.name: Pes cavus
HP:0001761.definition: An increase in height of the medial longitudinal arch of the foot that does not flatten on weight bearing (i.e., a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight).
HP:0001761.definition_cn: 足部内侧纵弓高度增加，在负重时未见扁平化（即足部负重时足底呈现明显凹陷形态）。

HP:0001762.name: Talipes equinovarus
HP:0001762.definition: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.
HP:0001762.definition_cn: 马蹄内翻足（也称为畸形足）通常具有四个主要组成部分：前足的内翻和内收；后足和跟骨的内翻；踝关节和距下关节的跖屈（伸展受限）；以及小腿的内旋。

HP:0001763.name: Pes planus
HP:0001763.definition: A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.
HP:0001763.definition_cn: 扁平足（Pes Planus），即当个体站立时，足部纵弓与地面接触；或患者仰卧位时，检查者以类似于负重预期的压力将平板按压于足底，足弓与平板表面接触；或足弓高度降低。

HP:0001765.name: Hammertoe
HP:0001765.definition: Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.
HP:0001765.definition_cn: 跖趾关节过伸伴近端指间关节（PIP）过屈。

HP:0001769.name: Broad foot
HP:0001769.definition: A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.
HP:0001769.definition_cn: 足部宽度测量值超过同年龄组第95百分位数；或，足部相对于其长度显得不成比例地宽大。

HP:0001770.name: Toe syndactyly
HP:0001770.definition: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as \\
HP:0001770.definition_cn: 趾蹼或趾融合，仅涉及软组织或包括骨结构。骨性融合称为“骨性并趾”。

HP:0001771.name: Achilles tendon contracture
HP:0001771.definition: A contracture of the Achilles tendon.

HP:0001772.name: Talipes equinovalgus
HP:0001772.definition: A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.
HP:0001772.definition_cn: 足踝畸形，表现为足部跖屈和外翻。

HP:0001773.name: Short foot
HP:0001773.definition: A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).
HP:0001773.definition_cn: 测量足长低于妊娠27至41周新生儿平均值的2个标准差，或足长低于出生至16岁个体第3百分位数（客观标准）。或者，足部外观明显短小（主观标准）。

HP:0001782.name: Bulbous tips of toes
HP:0001782.definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.
HP:0001782.definition_cn: 趾端形态异常，表现为趾端突出且呈球状。

HP:0001783.name: Broad metatarsal
HP:0001783.definition: Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.

HP:0001786.name: Narrow foot
HP:0001786.definition: A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.
HP:0001786.definition_cn: 足部宽度测量值低于同龄人群的第5百分位数；或，足部相对于其长度显得不成比例地狭窄。

HP:0001787.name: Abnormal delivery
HP:0001787.definition: An abnormality of the birth process.

HP:0001788.name: Premature rupture of membranes
HP:0001788.definition: Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.
HP:0001788.definition_cn: 胎膜早破（Premature Rupture of Membranes, PROM）是指在妊娠期间，羊膜囊在临产前超过一小时发生破裂的一种病理状态。

HP:0001789.name: Hydrops fetalis
HP:0001789.definition: The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.
HP:0001789.definition_cn: 胎儿两处或两处以上体腔异常积液，包括腹水、胸腔积液、心包积液及皮肤水肿。

HP:0001790.name: Nonimmune hydrops fetalis
HP:0001790.definition: A type of hydrops fetalis in which there is no identifiable circulating antibody to red blood cell antigens .
HP:0001790.definition_cn: 一种胎儿水肿类型，其中未发现针对红细胞抗原的循环抗体。

HP:0001791.name: Fetal ascites
HP:0001791.definition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.
HP:0001791.definition_cn: 胎儿期腹腔内液体积聚。

HP:0001792.name: Small nail
HP:0001792.definition: A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail.
HP:0001792.definition_cn: 短小指甲（Brachyonychia）或指甲发育不全（Hypoplastic Nail）。

HP:0001795.name: Hyperconvex nail
HP:0001795.definition: When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.
HP:0001795.definition_cn: 当从末端观察（指尖朝向检查者的眼睛）时，指甲的曲率形成更紧密的凸面曲线。

HP:0001802.name: Absent toenail
HP:0001802.definition_cn: 先天性趾甲缺失 (Congenital Onychodystrophy of the Toenail)

HP:0001803.name: Nail pits
HP:0001803.definition: Small (typically about 1 mm or less in size) depressions on the dorsal nail surface.
HP:0001803.definition_cn: 甲板背侧表面微小凹陷（通常约1毫米或更小）。

HP:0001805.name: Onychogryposis
HP:0001805.definition: Nail that appears thick when viewed on end.

HP:0001806.name: Onycholysis
HP:0001806.definition: Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.

HP:0001807.name: Ridged nail
HP:0001807.definition: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.

HP:0001809.name: Split nail
HP:0001809.definition: A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.
HP:0001809.definition_cn: 甲板纵向分离，且两部分甲板具有相同的横向曲率半径。

HP:0001810.name: Dystrophic toenail
HP:0001810.definition: Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.
HP:0001810.definition_cn: 趾甲改变，除趾甲颜色改变（甲色素异常）外，涉及甲板各角蛋白层的部分或完全破坏。

HP:0001812.name: Hyperconvex fingernails
HP:0001812.definition: When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.
HP:0001812.definition_cn: 当从末端观察（指尖朝向检查者的眼睛）时，指甲的曲率形成更紧密的凸面曲线。

HP:0001816.name: Thin nail
HP:0001816.definition: Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.

HP:0001818.name: Paronychia
HP:0001818.definition: The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).
HP:0001818.definition_cn: 甲沟炎（Paronychia）是一种常见且伴有疼痛的细菌性或真菌性手部或足部感染，主要发生在指甲与皮肤交界处的侧缘或基底部。该感染可突然发作（急性甲沟炎）或逐渐发展（慢性甲沟炎）。

HP:0001822.name: Hallux valgus
HP:0001822.definition: Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).
HP:0001822.definition_cn: 拇趾外翻（即拇趾向小趾方向偏移）。

HP:0001827.name: Genital tract atresia
HP:0001827.definition: Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.
HP:0001827.definition_cn: 生殖道管腔先天性闭塞。

HP:0001829.name: Foot polydactyly
HP:0001829.definition: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.
HP:0001829.definition_cn: 一种以存在多余足趾为特征的多趾畸形。

HP:0001830.name: Postaxial foot polydactyly
HP:0001830.definition: Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.
HP:0001830.definition_cn: 足部多指畸形最常见的是指单足存在六个趾头。轴后型多指畸形影响外侧列，其重复结构可能从形态良好的关节趾到发育不全的原始趾不等。

HP:0001831.name: Short toe
HP:0001831.definition: A toe that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.

HP:0001832.name: Abnormal metatarsal morphology
HP:0001832.definition: Abnormalities of the metatarsal bones (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).
HP:0001832.definition_cn: 跖骨异常（即位于后足和中足跗骨与趾骨之间的五根管状骨）。

HP:0001833.name: Long foot
HP:0001833.definition: Increased back to front length of the foot.

HP:0001836.name: Camptodactyly of toe
HP:0001836.definition: Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.
HP:0001836.definition_cn: 屈曲指是一种无痛性的近端指间关节（PIP）屈曲挛缩，通常呈渐进性发展。该术语指一个或多个足趾的屈曲指。

HP:0001837.name: Broad toe
HP:0001837.definition: Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.
HP:0001837.definition_cn: 非拇趾趾宽度的明显增加，但背腹维度未见增加。

HP:0001838.name: Rocker bottom foot
HP:0001838.definition: The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.
HP:0001838.definition_cn: 显著的足跟和足底凸面轮廓的存在。

HP:0001839.name: Split foot
HP:0001839.definition: A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.
HP:0001839.definition_cn: 一种表现为足中部（足趾和跖骨）缺失，呈现裂隙样外观的病症。其严重程度差异较大，可从第三足趾轻度发育不良，到第二或第三足趾缺失，甚至出现少趾或单趾足。

HP:0001840.name: Metatarsus adductus
HP:0001840.definition: The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.
HP:0001840.definition_cn: 跖骨向内侧（胫侧）偏斜，即足前半部分的骨骼向身体内侧弯曲或内翻。

HP:0001841.name: Preaxial foot polydactyly
HP:0001841.definition: Duplication of all or part of the first ray.
HP:0001841.definition_cn: 第一趾列全部或部分重复。

HP:0001844.name: Abnormal hallux morphology
HP:0001844.definition: This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.
HP:0001844.definition_cn: 该术语适用于所有大脚趾（也称为拇趾）的异常情况。

HP:0001845.name: Overlapping toe
HP:0001845.definition: Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest. Initially clawing may be dynamic and only noticeable on walking. Over time the plantar plate tears, subluxation occurs at the metatarsophalangeal joint (MTPJ), and the deformity becomes permanent.
HP:0001845.definition_cn: 描述足部在静止状态下，一个足趾位于相邻足趾背侧表面的情况。初期，爪形趾可能是动态的，仅在行走时明显。随着时间的推移，足底板撕裂，跖趾关节（MTPJ）发生半脱位，畸形变为永久性。

HP:0001847.name: Long hallux
HP:0001847.definition: Increased length of the big toe.

HP:0001848.name: Calcaneovalgus deformity
HP:0001848.definition: This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).
HP:0001848.definition_cn: 这是一种姿势畸形，表现为足部紧贴胫骨。跟骨（calcaneus）向下移位（即踝关节向上屈曲），且跟骨向外翻转（外翻，valgus）。

HP:0001849.name: Foot oligodactyly
HP:0001849.definition: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.
HP:0001849.definition_cn: 发育缺陷导致趾骨数量少于正常值。

HP:0001850.name: Abnormality of the tarsal bones
HP:0001850.definition: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.
HP:0001850.definition_cn: 跗骨异常是指位于胫骨和腓骨与跖骨之间的足部七块骨骼的异常，包括跟骨（足跟骨）和距骨（踝骨）。

HP:0001852.name: Sandal gap
HP:0001852.definition: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.
HP:0001852.definition_cn: 第一趾（拇趾）与第二趾之间的间距增宽。

HP:0001854.name: Podagra
HP:0001854.definition: Gout affecting the Metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe.
HP:0001854.definition_cn: 痛风累及大脚趾的跖趾关节。

HP:0001857.name: Short distal phalanx of toe
HP:0001857.definition: Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short distal phalanx of toe.
HP:0001857.definition_cn: 趾端至最远端趾间皱褶或远端趾间关节屈曲点的距离过短，即趾骨远端异常短缩。

HP:0001862.name: obsolete Acral ulceration and osteomyelitis leading to autoamputation of the digits (feet)
HP:0001862.name_cn: 陈旧性肢端溃疡和骨髓炎导致指（趾）自发性截肢（足部）

HP:0001863.name: Toe clinodactyly
HP:0001863.definition: Bending or curvature of a toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
HP:0001863.definition_cn: 趾骨向胫侧方向（即朝向拇趾）弯曲或成角畸形。

HP:0001864.name: Clinodactyly of the 5th toe
HP:0001864.definition: Bending or curvature of a fifth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
HP:0001864.definition_cn: 第五趾向胫侧方向（即朝向拇趾）弯曲或成角畸形。

HP:0001868.name: Autoamputation of foot
HP:0001868.definition: The spontaneous detachment of a foot from the body due to long standing pathology.
HP:0001868.definition_cn: 由于长期病理变化导致的足部自发性离断。

HP:0001869.name: Deep plantar creases
HP:0001869.definition: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot.
HP:0001869.definition_cn: 足底皮肤出现异常深度的皱褶（脊纹/皱纹）。

HP:0001870.name: Acroosteolysis of distal phalanges (feet)
HP:0001870.name_cn: 远端指骨（足部）肢端骨质溶解症

HP:0001871.name: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
HP:0001871.definition: An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.

HP:0001873.name: Thrombocytopenia
HP:0001873.definition: A reduction in the number of circulating thrombocytes.

HP:0001875.name: Neutropenia
HP:0001875.definition: An abnormally low number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood.
HP:0001875.definition_cn: 外周血中性粒细胞计数异常降低。

HP:0001876.name: Pancytopenia
HP:0001876.definition: An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).

HP:0001877.name: Abnormal erythrocyte morphology
HP:0001877.definition: Any structural abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).
HP:0001877.definition_cn: 红细胞（红细胞）的任何结构异常。

HP:0001878.name: Hemolytic anemia
HP:0001878.definition: A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).
HP:0001878.definition_cn: 一种由红细胞过早破坏（溶血）引起的贫血类型。

HP:0001879.name: Abnormal eosinophil morphology
HP:0001879.definition: An abnormal count or structure of eosinophils.
HP:0001879.name_cn: 异常嗜酸性粒细胞形态
HP:0001879.definition_cn: 嗜酸性粒细胞计数或结构异常。

HP:0001880.name: Eosinophilia
HP:0001880.definition: Increased count of eosinophils in the blood.
HP:0001880.definition_cn: 血液中嗜酸性粒细胞计数增高。

HP:0001882.name: Leukopenia
HP:0001882.definition: An abnormal decreased number of leukocytes in the blood.
HP:0001882.definition_cn: 血液中白细胞数量异常减少。

HP:0001883.name: Talipes
HP:0001883.definition: A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.
HP:0001883.definition_cn: 足踝畸形，其不同亚型包括马蹄内翻足、马蹄外翻足、跟骨内翻足和跟骨外翻足。

HP:0001884.name: Talipes calcaneovalgus
HP:0001884.definition: Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an \\
HP:0001884.definition_cn: 跟骨外翻足是一种柔韧性足部畸形（与僵硬的先天性垂直距骨足畸形相对），根据严重程度和/或病因，可表现为位置性或结构性足部畸形。跟骨外翻畸形的轴线位于胫距关节，足部处于极度背伸位。检查时，足部呈现...

HP:0001885.name: Short 2nd toe
HP:0001885.definition_cn: 第二趾发育不全（第二趾发育不良）。

HP:0001886.name: Foot osteomyelitis
HP:0001886.definition: An infection of bone of the foot.
HP:0001886.definition_cn: 足部骨髓炎（Osteomyelitis of the foot）。

HP:0001888.name: Lymphopenia
HP:0001888.definition: A reduced number of lymphocytes in the blood.

HP:0001889.name: Megaloblastic anemia
HP:0001889.definition: Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts).
HP:0001889.definition_cn: 以存在大于正常红细胞（巨幼红细胞）为特征的贫血。

HP:0001890.name: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia
HP:0001890.definition: An autoimmune form of hemolytic anemia.
HP:0001890.name_cn: 自身免疫性溶血性贫血
HP:0001890.definition_cn: 自身免疫性溶血性贫血。

HP:0001892.name: Abnormal bleeding
HP:0001892.definition: An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects.
HP:0001892.definition_cn: 异常出血倾向，常称为出血性素质。出血性素质可能与血管、血小板及凝血功能缺陷相关。

HP:0001894.name: Thrombocytosis
HP:0001894.definition: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood.
HP:0001894.definition_cn: 外周血中血小板数量增多。

HP:0001896.name: Reticulocytopenia
HP:0001896.definition: A reduced number of reticulocytes in the peripheral blood.
HP:0001896.definition_cn: 外周血中网织红细胞数量减少。

HP:0001897.name: Normocytic anemia
HP:0001897.definition: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal.
HP:0001897.definition_cn: 一种红细胞体积正常的贫血症。

HP:0001898.name: Increased red blood cell mass
HP:0001898.definition: The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.
HP:0001898.definition_cn: 循环中红细胞质量增加。

HP:0001899.name: Increased hematocrit
HP:0001899.definition: An elevation above the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.
HP:0001899.definition_cn: 红细胞压积高于正常范围。

HP:0001900.name: Increased circulating hemoglobin concentration
HP:0001900.definition: Concentration of hemoglobin in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.
HP:0001900.name_cn: 循环血红蛋白浓度升高
HP:0001900.definition_cn: 循环血液中血红蛋白浓度高于正常值上限。

HP:0001901.name: Polycythemia
HP:0001901.definition: Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.
HP:0001901.definition_cn: 红细胞增多症的诊断标准为红细胞计数、血红蛋白水平及红细胞压积均超过正常值上限。

HP:0001902.name: Giant platelets
HP:0001902.definition: Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).
HP:0001902.definition_cn: 巨血小板直径大于7微米，通常为10至20微米。当血小板体积大于视野中平均红细胞大小时，即称为巨血小板。（描述参考自美国病理学家协会，血液学手册，1998年）。

HP:0001903.name: Anemia
HP:0001903.definition: A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration.
HP:0001903.definition_cn: 红细胞体积或血红蛋白浓度降低。

HP:0001904.name: Neutropenia in presence of anti-neutropil antibodies
HP:0001904.definition: A type of neutropenia that is observed in the presence of granulocyte-specific antibodies.
HP:0001904.name_cn: 抗中性粒细胞抗体存在下的中性粒细胞减少症
HP:0001904.definition_cn: 一种在存在粒细胞特异性抗体的情况下观察到的中性粒细胞减少症。

HP:0001907.name: Thromboembolism
HP:0001907.definition: The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.
HP:0001907.definition_cn: 血管内血栓形成，随后通过血流从形成部位迁移至体内另一位置，通常导致远端部位血管闭塞。

HP:0001908.name: Hypoplastic anemia
HP:0001908.definition: Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.
HP:0001908.definition_cn: 不同程度的红细胞生成障碍性贫血，不伴白细胞减少或血小板减少。

HP:0001909.name: Leukemia
HP:0001909.definition: A cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an abnormal proliferation of leukocytes.
HP:0001909.definition_cn: 一种以白细胞异常增殖为特征的血液和骨髓癌症。

HP:0001911.name: Abnormal granulocyte morphology
HP:0001911.definition: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.
HP:0001911.definition_cn: 粒细胞结构异常或数量异常。

HP:0001912.name: Abnormal basophil morphology
HP:0001912.definition: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of basophils.
HP:0001912.name_cn: 异常嗜碱性粒细胞形态
HP:0001912.definition_cn: 任何嗜碱性粒细胞的结构异常或计数异常。

HP:0001913.name: Granulocytopenia
HP:0001913.definition: An abnormally reduced number of granulocytes in the blood.

HP:0001915.name: Aplastic anemia
HP:0001915.definition: Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.
HP:0001915.definition_cn: 再生障碍性贫血定义为全血细胞减少伴骨髓增生低下。

HP:0001917.name: Renal amyloidosis
HP:0001917.definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the kidney. On hematoxylin and eosin stain, amyloid is identified as extracellular amorphous material that is lightly eosinophilic. These deposits often stain weakly for periodic acid Schiff (PAS), demonstrate a blue-to-gray hue on the trichrome stain and are typically negative on the Jones methenamine silver (JMS) stain. These tinctorial properties contrast with the histologic appearance of collagen, a major component of basement membranes, mesangial matrix and areas of sclerosis, which demonstrates strong positivity for PAS and JMS (See Figure 1 of PMID:25852856).
HP:0001917.definition_cn: 一种影响肾脏的淀粉样变性。在苏木精和伊红染色中，淀粉样物质被识别为细胞外无定形物质，呈轻度嗜酸性。这些沉积物在过碘酸希夫（PAS）染色中通常呈弱阳性，在三色染色中呈现蓝灰色调，而在琼斯六胺银（JMS）染色中通常为阴性。这些染色特性与胶原的组织学表现形成对比，胶原是基底膜、系膜基质和硬化区域的主要成分，在PAS和JMS染色中呈强阳性（参见PMID:25852856的图1）。

HP:0001919.name: Acute kidney injury
HP:0001919.definition: Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia).
HP:0001919.definition_cn: 急性肾功能衰竭，表现为尿量减少，血清肌酐或血尿素氮浓度升高（氮质血症）。

HP:0001920.name: Renal artery stenosis
HP:0001920.definition: The presence of stenosis of the renal artery.

HP:0001922.name: Vacuolated lymphocytes
HP:0001922.definition: The presence of clear, sharply defined vacuoles in the lymphocyte cytoplasm.
HP:0001922.definition_cn: 淋巴细胞胞质内存在清晰、界限分明的空泡。

HP:0001923.name: Reticulocytosis
HP:0001923.definition: An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation.
HP:0001923.definition_cn: 外周血液循环中网织红细胞（未成熟红细胞）数量升高。

HP:0001924.name: Sideroblastic anemia
HP:0001924.definition: Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).
HP:0001924.definition_cn: 铁粒幼细胞性贫血是由于铁掺入血红素分子过程中存在缺陷所致。铁粒幼细胞是一种在细胞质中含有可染色铁沉积物的幼红细胞（可通过普鲁士蓝染色法进行显示）。

HP:0001927.name: Acanthocytosis
HP:0001927.definition: Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shape resembling many-pointed stars.
HP:0001927.definition_cn: 棘形红细胞增多症是一种异形红细胞症，其特征是细胞表面出现棘状突起。细胞呈不规则形状，类似于多角星形。

HP:0001928.name: Abnormality of coagulation
HP:0001928.definition: An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.
HP:0001928.definition_cn: 血液凝固过程异常。即血液凝固能力改变或丧失。

HP:0001929.name: Reduced factor XI activity
HP:0001929.definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.
HP:0001929.definition_cn: 凝血因子XI活性降低。因子XI，又称血浆凝血活酶前体，是一种丝氨酸蛋白酶，可激活因子IX。

HP:0001930.name: Nonspherocytic hemolytic anemia
HP:0001930.name_cn: 非球形红细胞性溶血性贫血

HP:0001931.name: Hypochromic anemia
HP:0001931.definition: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes.
HP:0001931.definition_cn: 一种以红细胞中血红蛋白浓度异常降低为特征的贫血类型。

HP:0001933.name: Subcutaneous hemorrhage
HP:0001933.definition: This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses).
HP:0001933.definition_cn: 该术语指异常增加的易瘀伤倾向（紫癜、瘀点或瘀斑）。

HP:0001935.name: Microcytic anemia
HP:0001935.definition: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is reduced.
HP:0001935.definition_cn: 一种红细胞体积减少的贫血症。

HP:0001937.name: Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia
HP:0001937.name_cn: 微血管病性溶血性贫血

HP:0001941.name: Acidosis
HP:0001941.definition: Abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

HP:0001942.name: Metabolic acidosis
HP:0001942.definition: Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause.
HP:0001942.definition_cn: 代谢性酸中毒（Metabolic Acidosis, MA）的特征是由于血清碳酸氢盐浓度降低导致的血液pH值下降。这种情况可能由酸类物质积累（高阴离子间隙型代谢性酸中毒）或胃肠道或肾脏碳酸氢盐丢失（高氯性代谢性酸中毒）引起。根据定义，代谢性酸中毒并非由呼吸性原因所致。

HP:0001943.name: Hypoglycemia
HP:0001943.definition: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

HP:0001945.name: Fever
HP:0001945.definition: Body temperature elevated above the normal range.
HP:0001945.definition_cn: 体温升高超出正常范围。

HP:0001946.name: Ketosis
HP:0001946.definition: Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

HP:0001947.name: Renal tubular acidosis
HP:0001947.definition: Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.
HP:0001947.definition_cn: 由于肾小管功能障碍导致的酸中毒，伴随代谢性酸积聚和高氯血症，可能引发包括低钾血症、高钙尿症、肾结石和肾钙质沉着症在内的并发症。

HP:0001948.name: Alkalosis
HP:0001948.definition: Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.

HP:0001950.name: Respiratory alkalosis
HP:0001950.definition: Alkalosis due to excess loss of carbon dioxide from the body.
HP:0001950.definition_cn: 由于体内二氧化碳过度流失导致的碱中毒。

HP:0001952.name: Glucose intolerance
HP:0001952.definition: Glucose intolerance (GI) can be defined as dysglycemia that comprises both prediabetes and diabetes. It includes the conditions of impaired fasting glucose (IFG) and impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) and diabetes mellitus (DM).
HP:0001952.definition_cn: 葡萄糖耐受不良（Glucose Intolerance, GI）可定义为包括糖尿病前期（Prediabetes）和糖尿病（Diabetes Mellitus, DM）在内的血糖调节异常。它包括空腹血糖受损（Impaired Fasting Glucose, IFG）、糖耐量受损（Impaired Glucose Tolerance, IGT）以及糖尿病（Diabetes Mellitus, DM）。

HP:0001953.name: Diabetic ketoacidosis
HP:0001953.definition: A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.
HP:0001953.definition_cn: 一种伴有酮体蓄积的糖尿病代谢异常。

HP:0001954.name: Recurrent fever
HP:0001954.definition: Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever.
HP:0001954.definition_cn: 周期性（阵发性或复发性）发热发作。

HP:0001955.name: Unexplained fevers
HP:0001955.definition: Episodes of fever for which no infectious cause can be identified.
HP:0001955.name_cn: 不明原因发热 (Fever of Unknown Origin, FUO)
HP:0001955.definition_cn: 不明原因发热（Fever of Unknown Origin, FUO）

HP:0001956.name: Truncal obesity
HP:0001956.definition: Obesity located preferentially in the trunk of the body as opposed to the extremities.

HP:0001959.name: Polydipsia
HP:0001959.definition: Excessive thirst manifested by excessive fluid intake.
HP:0001959.definition_cn: 多饮症（Polydipsia）表现为液体摄入量异常增多。

HP:0001962.name: Palpitations
HP:0001962.definition: A sensation that the heart is pounding or racing, which is a non-specific sign but may be a manifestation of arrhythmia.
HP:0001962.definition_cn: 心悸（Palpitation），一种非特异性症状，可能为心律失常（Arrhythmia）的临床表现。

HP:0001963.name: Abnormal speech discrimination
HP:0001963.definition: A type of hearing impairment prominently characterized by a difficulty in understanding speech, rather than an inability to hear speech. Poor speech discrimination is a very common symptom of high frequency hearing loss.
HP:0001963.definition_cn: 一种以理解言语困难为主要特征的听力障碍，而非无法听到言语。言语辨别能力差是高频听力损失的一个非常常见的症状。

HP:0001964.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of metatarsal bones
HP:0001964.definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the metatarsal bones.
HP:0001964.name_cn: 跖骨发育不全/跖骨发育不良

HP:0001965.name: Abnormal scalp morphology
HP:0001965.definition: Any anomaly of the scalp, the skin an subcutaneous tissue of the head on which head hair grows.
HP:0001965.definition_cn: 头皮异常，即头发生长的头部皮肤及皮下组织的任何异常。

HP:0001966.name: Abnormal glomerular mesangium morphology
HP:0001966.definition: An abnormality of the mesangium, i.e., of the central part of the renal glomerulus between capillaries.
HP:0001966.definition_cn: 肾小球系膜异常，即肾小球毛细血管间中央部分的异常。

HP:0001967.name: Diffuse mesangial sclerosis
HP:0001967.definition: Diffuse sclerosis of the mesangium, as manifestated by diffuse mesangial matrix expansion.
HP:0001967.definition_cn: 弥漫性系膜硬化，表现为弥漫性系膜基质扩张。

HP:0001969.name: Abnormal tubulointerstitial morphology
HP:0001969.definition: An abnormality that involves the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.
HP:0001969.definition_cn: 涉及肾小管和肾间质组织的异常。

HP:0001970.name: Tubulointerstitial nephritis
HP:0001970.definition: A form of inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.
HP:0001970.definition_cn: 一种影响肾小管周围肾间质的肾脏炎症形式。

HP:0001971.name: Hypersplenism
HP:0001971.definition: A malfunctioning of the spleen in which it prematurely destroys red blood cells.
HP:0001971.definition_cn: 脾功能亢进导致红细胞过早破坏。

HP:0001972.name: Macrocytic anemia
HP:0001972.definition: A type of anemia characterized by increased size of erythrocytes with increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH).
HP:0001972.definition_cn: 一种以红细胞体积增大、平均红细胞体积（MCV）增加和平均红细胞血红蛋白量（MCH）增加为特征的贫血类型。

HP:0001973.name: Autoimmune thrombocytopenia
HP:0001973.definition: The presence of thrombocytopenia in combination with detection of antiplatelet antibodies.
HP:0001973.name_cn: 自身免疫性血小板减少症
HP:0001973.definition_cn: 血小板减少症合并抗血小板抗体检测阳性。

HP:0001974.name: Leukocytosis
HP:0001974.definition: An abnormal increase in the number of leukocytes in the blood.

HP:0001975.name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein IIb-IIIa
HP:0001975.definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein IIb-IIIa.
HP:0001975.definition_cn: 糖蛋白IIb-IIIa在细胞膜上的浓度降低。

HP:0001976.name: Reduced antithrombin III activity
HP:0001976.definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of antithrombin-III.
HP:0001976.definition_cn: 与抗凝血酶III浓度降低相关的凝血异常。

HP:0001977.name: Abnormal thrombosis
HP:0001977.definition: Venous or arterial thrombosis (formation of blood clots) of spontaneous nature and which cannot be fully explained by acquired risk (e.g. atherosclerosis).
HP:0001977.definition_cn: 自发性静脉或动脉血栓形成（血凝块形成），且无法完全由获得性风险因素（如动脉粥样硬化）解释。

HP:0001978.name: Extramedullary hematopoiesis
HP:0001978.definition: The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.
HP:0001978.definition_cn: 出生后个体中发生在骨髓外（肝脏、胸腺和脾脏）的造血过程。

HP:0001980.name: Megaloblastic bone marrow
HP:0001980.definition: Abnormal increased number of megaloblasts in the bone marrow.
HP:0001980.definition_cn: 骨髓中巨幼红细胞异常增多。

HP:0001981.name: Schistocytosis
HP:0001981.definition: The presence of an abnormal number of fragmented red blood cells (schistocytes) in the blood.
HP:0001981.definition_cn: 血液中存在异常数量的破碎红细胞（裂红细胞）。

HP:0001982.name: Sea-blue histiocytosis
HP:0001982.definition: An abnormality of histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content. Histiocytes are a type of macrophage. Sea-blue histiocytes are typically large macrophages from 20 to 60 micrometers in diameter with a single eccentric nucleus whose cytoplasm if packed with sea-blue or blue-green granules when stained with Wright-Giemsa.
HP:0001982.name_cn: 海蓝色组织细胞增生症
HP:0001982.definition_cn: 组织细胞异常，由于脂质含量异常增加，细胞呈现海蓝色外观。组织细胞是一种巨噬细胞。海蓝色组织细胞通常为直径20至60微米的大型巨噬细胞，具有单个偏心核，其细胞质在Wright-Giemsa染色时充满海蓝色或蓝绿色颗粒。

HP:0001983.name: Reduced lymphocyte surface expression of CD43
HP:0001983.definition: A reduction in the expression of CD43 on the cell surface of lymphocytes.
HP:0001983.name_cn: 淋巴细胞表面CD43表达降低
HP:0001983.definition_cn: 淋巴细胞表面CD43表达降低。

HP:0001985.name: Hypoketotic hypoglycemia
HP:0001985.definition: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood associated with a reduced concentration of ketone bodies.
HP:0001985.definition_cn: 低血糖症伴酮体浓度降低。

HP:0001987.name: Hyperammonemia
HP:0001987.definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

HP:0001988.name: Recurrent hypoglycemia
HP:0001988.definition: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

HP:0001989.name: Fetal akinesia sequence
HP:0001989.definition: Decreased fetal activity associated with multiple joint contractures, facial anomalies and pulmonary hypoplasia. Ultrasound examination may reveal polyhydramnios, ankylosis, scalp edema, and decreased chest movements (reflecting pulmonary hypoplasia).
HP:0001989.definition_cn: 胎儿活动减少伴有多发性关节挛缩、面部畸形及肺发育不全。超声检查可显示羊水过多、关节强直、头皮水肿及胸部运动减少（反映肺发育不全）。

HP:0001991.name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of toe
HP:0001991.name_cn: 趾发育不全/趾发育不良

HP:0001992.name: Organic aciduria
HP:0001992.definition: Excretion of non-amino organic acids in urine.
HP:0001992.definition_cn: 尿液中非氨基酸有机酸的排泄。

HP:0001993.name: Ketoacidosis
HP:0001993.definition: Acidosis resulting from accumulation of ketone bodies.
HP:0001993.definition_cn: 酮体蓄积导致的酸中毒。

HP:0001994.name: Renal Fanconi syndrome
HP:0001994.definition: An inability of the tubules in the kidney to reabsorb small molecules, causing increased urinary loss of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, bicarbonate), minerals, glucose, amino acids, and water.
HP:0001994.definition_cn: 肾小管重吸收功能障碍，导致电解质（钠、钾、碳酸氢盐）、矿物质、葡萄糖、氨基酸和水的尿中丢失增加。

HP:0001995.name: Hyperchloremic acidosis
HP:0001995.definition: Acidosis (pH less than 7.35) that develops with an increase in ionic chloride.

HP:0001997.name: Gout
HP:0001997.definition: Recurrent attacks of acute inflammatory arthritis of a joint or set of joints caused by elevated levels of uric acid in the blood which crystallize and are deposited in joints, tendons, and surrounding tissues.
HP:0001997.definition_cn: 由血液中尿酸水平升高引起的关节或一组关节的急性炎症性关节炎反复发作，尿酸结晶并沉积于关节、肌腱及周围组织中。

HP:0001999.name: Abnormal facial shape
HP:0001999.definition: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.
HP:0001999.definition_cn: 面部或其组成部分的异常形态学（形态）表现。

HP:0002000.name: Short columella
HP:0002000.definition: Reduced distance from the anterior border of the naris to the subnasale.
HP:0002000.definition_cn: 鼻前缘至鼻下点的距离缩短。

HP:0002002.name: Deep philtrum
HP:0002002.definition: Accentuated, prominent philtral ridges giving rise to an exaggerated groove in the midline between the nasal base and upper vermillion border.
HP:0002002.definition_cn: 鼻基底与上唇红缘之间中线处，显著突出的鼻唇沟嵴导致沟槽加深。

HP:0002006.name: Tessier cleft
HP:0002006.definition: A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the face.
HP:0002006.definition_cn: 先天性面部裂畸形（面裂）。

HP:0002007.name: Frontal bossing
HP:0002007.definition: Bilateral bulging of the lateral frontal bone prominences with relative sparing of the midline.
HP:0002007.definition_cn: 双侧额骨外侧隆起，中线区域相对保留。

HP:0002009.name: Potter facies
HP:0002009.definition: A facial appearance characteristic of a fetus or neonate due to oligohydramnios experienced in the womb, comprising ocular hypertelorism, low-set ears, receding chin, and flattening of the nose.
HP:0002009.definition_cn: 由于宫内羊水过少导致的胎儿或新生儿面部特征，包括眼距过宽、低位耳、下颌后缩及鼻部扁平。

HP:0002011.name: Morphological central nervous system abnormality
HP:0002011.definition: A structural abnormality of the central nervous system.
HP:0002011.name_cn: 形态学中枢神经系统异常
HP:0002011.definition_cn: 中枢神经系统结构异常。

HP:0002012.name: Abnormality of the abdominal organs
HP:0002012.definition: An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen.

HP:0002013.name: Vomiting
HP:0002013.definition: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions.
HP:0002013.definition_cn: 通过一系列不自主的痉挛性收缩，将胃内容物经口腔强力排出的过程。

HP:0002014.name: Diarrhea
HP:0002014.definition: Abnormally increased frequency (usually defined as three or more) loose or watery bowel movements a day.
HP:0002014.definition_cn: 排便频率异常增加（通常定义为每日三次或以上）且粪便呈稀便或水样便。

HP:0002017.name: Nausea and vomiting
HP:0002017.definition: Nausea is a commonly encountered symptom that has been defined as an unpleasant painless subjective feeling that one will imminently vomit. Vomiting has been defined as the forceful expulsion of the contents of the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum through the oral cavity. While nausea and vomiting are often thought to exist on a temporal continuum, this is not always the case. There are situations when severe nausea may be present without emesis and less frequently, when emesis may be present without preceding nausea.
HP:0002017.definition_cn: 恶心是一种常见的症状，被定义为一种即将发生呕吐的无痛性主观不适感。呕吐则被定义为胃、十二指肠或空肠内容物通过口腔的强力排出。虽然恶心和呕吐通常被认为存在于一个时间连续体上，但情况并非总是如此。在某些情况下，可能会出现严重的恶心而不伴随呕吐，而较少见的情况下，可能会出现呕吐而不伴随先前的恶心。

HP:0002018.name: Nausea
HP:0002018.definition: A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit.
HP:0002018.definition_cn: 胃部不适感伴恶心欲吐。

HP:0002019.name: Constipation
HP:0002019.definition: Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces.
HP:0002019.definition_cn: 排便困难或排便频率减少。

HP:0002020.name: Gastroesophageal reflux
HP:0002020.definition: A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter.
HP:0002020.definition_cn: 胃食管反流病（Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease, GERD）是一种胃内容物通过下食管括约肌（Lower Esophageal Sphincter, LES）从胃反流至食管内的病理状态。

HP:0002021.name: Pyloric stenosis
HP:0002021.definition: Pyloric stenosis, also known as infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, is an uncommon condition in infants characterized by abnormal thickening of the pylorus muscles in the stomach leading to gastric outlet obstruction. Clinically infants are well at birth. Then, at 3 to 6 weeks of age, the infants present with projectile vomiting, potentially leading to dehydration and weight loss.
HP:0002021.definition_cn: 幽门狭窄，亦称婴儿肥厚性幽门狭窄，是一种在婴儿中较为罕见的疾病，其特征为胃幽门肌肉异常增厚，导致胃出口梗阻。临床上，婴儿出生时状况良好。随后，在出生后3至6周，婴儿出现喷射性呕吐，可能引发脱水和体重减轻。

HP:0002023.name: Anal atresia
HP:0002023.definition: Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.
HP:0002023.definition_cn: 先天性肛门闭锁，即肠道末端开口缺失。

HP:0002024.name: Malabsorption
HP:0002024.definition: Impaired ability to absorb one or more nutrients from the intestine.
HP:0002024.definition_cn: 肠道吸收功能障碍（Impaired intestinal absorption of one or more nutrients）

HP:0002025.name: Anal stenosis
HP:0002025.definition: Abnormal narrowing of the anal opening.

HP:0002027.name: Abdominal pain
HP:0002027.definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the abdomen.
HP:0002027.definition_cn: 一种以身体不适（如刺痛、搏动性或酸痛）为特征的不愉快感觉，且感知起源于腹部。

HP:0002028.name: Chronic diarrhea
HP:0002028.definition: The presence of chronic diarrhea, which is usually taken to mean diarrhea that has persisted for over 4 weeks.
HP:0002028.definition_cn: 慢性腹泻的存在，通常定义为持续超过4周的腹泻。

HP:0002031.name: Abnormal esophagus morphology
HP:0002031.definition: A structural abnormality of the esophagus.

HP:0002032.name: Esophageal atresia
HP:0002032.definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.
HP:0002032.definition_cn: 食管闭锁，一种发育缺陷导致食管管腔完全闭塞，使食管末端形成盲袋而非与胃相连。

HP:0002033.name: Poor suck
HP:0002033.definition: An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.
HP:0002033.definition_cn: 吸吮反射不足，导致新生儿难以进行母乳喂养。

HP:0002034.name: Abnormal rectum morphology
HP:0002034.definition: An abnormaltiy of the rectum, the final segment of the large intestine that stores solid waste until it passes through the anus.
HP:0002034.definition_cn: 直肠异常，即大肠末端储存固体废物直至其通过肛门的节段出现异常。

HP:0002035.name: Rectal prolapse
HP:0002035.definition: Protrusion of the rectal mucous membrane through the anus.

HP:0002036.name: Hiatus hernia
HP:0002036.definition: The presence of a hernia in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the gastric cardia protrudes through the diaphragmatic esophageal hiatus.
HP:0002036.definition_cn: 胃上部（主要为胃贲门）通过膈肌食管裂孔突出的疝气存在。

HP:0002037.name: Inflammation of the large intestine
HP:0002037.definition: Inflammation, or an inflammatory state in the large intestine.
HP:0002037.definition_cn: 结肠炎（Colitis），或大肠炎症状态。

HP:0002039.name: Anorexia
HP:0002039.definition: Anorexia, or the loss of appetite for food, is a medical condition.
HP:0002039.definition_cn: 厌食症，即食欲减退，是一种医学病症。

HP:0002040.name: Esophageal varix
HP:0002040.definition: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus.
HP:0002040.definition_cn: 食管下段黏膜下层静脉极度扩张。

HP:0002043.name: Esophageal stricture
HP:0002043.definition: A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen.
HP:0002043.definition_cn: 食管狭窄（Esophageal Stricture），由瘢痕组织环形成导致食管管腔缩窄的病理状态。

HP:0002044.name: Zollinger-Ellison syndrome
HP:0002044.definition: A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.
HP:0002044.definition_cn: 一种由胃泌素分泌性肿瘤（通常位于胰腺、十二指肠或腹部淋巴结）导致胃泌素分泌增加的病理状态，该肿瘤刺激胃黏膜达到最大活性，进而引发胃肠道黏膜溃疡。

HP:0002045.name: Hypothermia
HP:0002045.definition: Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.
HP:0002045.definition_cn: 体温调节功能障碍导致的体温降低。

HP:0002046.name: Heat intolerance
HP:0002046.definition: The inability to maintain a comfortable body temperature in warm or hot weather.
HP:0002046.definition_cn: 体温调节功能障碍（Thermoregulatory Dysfunction）

HP:0002047.name: Malignant hyperthermia
HP:0002047.definition: Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C. Malignant hyperthermia may occur in response to either inhalational anesthetics such as halothane, to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine, or to exercise.
HP:0002047.definition_cn: 恶性高热（Malignant Hyperthermia）的特征是体温迅速升高至39-42摄氏度。恶性高热可能由吸入性麻醉剂（如氟烷）、肌肉松弛剂（如琥珀胆碱）或运动诱发。

HP:0002048.name: Renal cortical atrophy
HP:0002048.definition: Atrophy of the cortex of the kidney.

HP:0002049.name: Proximal renal tubular acidosis
HP:0002049.definition: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.
HP:0002049.definition_cn: 一种肾小管酸中毒类型，其特征为近端肾小管细胞重吸收碳酸氢盐功能障碍，导致尿中碳酸氢盐丢失及随后的酸血症。

HP:0002055.name: Curved linear dimple below the lower lip
HP:0002055.name_cn: 下唇下方的弧形线性凹陷

HP:0002058.name: Myopathic facies
HP:0002058.definition: A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness.
HP:0002058.definition_cn: 肌病面容特征。由于肌肉无力，面部呈现无表情状态，伴有双颊凹陷、双侧上睑下垂以及无法上提口角。

HP:0002059.name: Cerebral atrophy
HP:0002059.definition: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.
HP:0002059.definition_cn: 大脑萎缩（脑组织或细胞体积减少）。

HP:0002060.name: Abnormal cerebral morphology
HP:0002060.definition: Any structural abnormality of the telencephalon, which is also known as the cerebrum.
HP:0002060.definition_cn: 端脑（也称为大脑）的任何结构异常。

HP:0002061.name: Lower limb spasticity
HP:0002061.definition: Spasticity (velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone and hyperexcitable tendon reflexes) in the muscles of the lower limbs, hips, and pelvis.
HP:0002061.definition_cn: 下肢、髋部和骨盆肌肉的痉挛（速度依赖性肌张力增高，伴随牵张反射增强和腱反射亢进）。

HP:0002062.name: Abnormal pyramidal tract morphology
HP:0002062.definition: Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.
HP:0002062.definition_cn: 锥体束的任何结构异常，其主要组成部分为皮质脊髓束，是大脑与脊髓之间唯一的直接连接。除皮质脊髓束外，锥体系统还包括皮质延髓束、皮质中脑束和皮质脑桥束。

HP:0002063.name: Rigidity
HP:0002063.definition: Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.
HP:0002063.definition_cn: 持续性不自主的肌肉强直收缩。当受累肌肉被动拉伸时，无论拉伸速度如何，阻力程度保持不变。这一特征有助于将强直与肌肉痉挛相鉴别。

HP:0002064.name: Spastic gait
HP:0002064.definition: Spasticity is manifested by increased stretch reflex which is intensified with movement velocity. This results in excessive and inappropriate muscle activation which can contribute to muscle hypertonia. Spastic gait is characterized by manifestations such as muscle hypertonia, stiff knee, and circumduction of the leg.
HP:0002064.definition_cn: 痉挛表现为牵张反射增强，且随着运动速度的增加而加剧。这导致肌肉过度和不适当的激活，从而可能导致肌张力增高。痉挛步态的特征包括肌张力增高、膝关节僵硬以及下肢划圈运动。

HP:0002066.name: Gait ataxia
HP:0002066.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking. Gait ataxia is characteirzed by a wide-based staggering gait with a tendency to fall.
HP:0002066.definition_cn: 一种共济失调类型，其特征为协调正常行走所需运动的能力受损。步态共济失调表现为宽基底、蹒跚步态，并伴有跌倒倾向。

HP:0002067.name: Bradykinesia
HP:0002067.definition: Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).
HP:0002067.definition_cn: 运动迟缓（Bradykinesia）字面意思是指运动缓慢，临床上用于表示运动执行速度的减慢（与运动减少（Hypokinesia）相对，后者用于指运动启动的缓慢）。

HP:0002069.name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure
HP:0002069.definition: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure is a seizure defined by a tonic (bilateral increased tone, lasting seconds to minutes) and then a clonic (bilateral sustained rhythmic jerking) phase.
HP:0002069.definition_cn: 双侧强直-阵挛性发作是一种以强直期（双侧肌张力增高，持续数秒至数分钟）和随后的阵挛期（双侧持续性节律性抽搐）为特征的癫痫发作。

HP:0002070.name: Limb ataxia
HP:0002070.definition: A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.
HP:0002070.definition_cn: 一种影响四肢运动的小脑性共济失调。

HP:0002071.name: Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
HP:0002071.definition: A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).
HP:0002071.name_cn: 锥体外系运动功能异常
HP:0002071.definition_cn: 一种与基底节病变相关的神经系统疾病，导致典型的异常表现，包括运动不能（无法启动活动变化并迅速、轻松地执行随意运动）、肌强直（肌肉持续收缩，对被动运动产生恒定阻力）、舞蹈症（广泛性、无节律性、强制性、快速、急促且不安宁的运动）、手足徐动症（无法维持手指、脚趾或其他肌肉群处于固定位置）以及静坐不能（无法保持静止）。

HP:0002072.name: Chorea
HP:0002072.definition: Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.
HP:0002072.definition_cn: 舞蹈症（源自希腊语“舞蹈”）指的是广泛性、非节律性、强制性、急动性且不安宁的不自主运动。它表现为一系列随机出现的一个或多个离散的不自主运动或运动片段。由于时间、持续时间或位置的可变性，这些运动显得随机。每个运动可能有明确的起始和终止。然而，运动可能串联在一起，从而似乎随机地从一个肌群流向另一个肌群。舞蹈症可累及躯干、颈部、面部、舌和四肢。

HP:0002073.name: Progressive cerebellar ataxia
HP:0002073.name_cn: 进行性小脑性共济失调

HP:0002074.name: Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
HP:0002074.definition: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.
HP:0002074.name_cn: 神经元自荧光脂褐素增加
HP:0002074.definition_cn: 脂褐素（Lipofuscin），一种泛指自荧光性脂色素的通用术语，是由蛋白质和脂质组成的混合物，主要积累于大多数衰老细胞中，尤其是在高脂质代谢（如肾上腺髓质）或吞噬其他细胞类型（如视网膜色素上皮细胞或RPE；巨噬细胞）的细胞中。该术语适用于患者神经元中脂褐素（也称为自荧光性脂蛋白）的积累量超过其年龄预期水平的情况。

HP:0002075.name: Dysdiadochokinesis
HP:0002075.definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as pronating and supinating his or her hand on the dorsum of the other hand as rapidly as possible.
HP:0002075.definition_cn: 一种共济失调类型，其特征为快速交替运动能力受损，例如无法尽可能快速地在另一只手的手背上进行手掌旋前和旋后动作。

HP:0002076.name: Migraine
HP:0002076.definition: Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.
HP:0002076.definition_cn: 偏头痛是一种慢性神经系统疾病，其特征为发作性头痛及相关症状。

HP:0002077.name: Migraine with aura
HP:0002077.definition: A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.
HP:0002077.definition_cn: 一种偏头痛类型，其特征为先兆，表现为局灶性神经功能异常，通常先于头痛发生，但也可能伴随头痛或在无头痛时出现。先兆症状可能包括完全可逆的视觉、感觉和语言症状，但不包括运动无力。视觉症状可能包括闪光、斑点、线条和/或视力丧失，和/或单侧感觉症状如感觉异常或麻木。至少一种先兆症状在5分钟或更长时间内逐渐发展，和/或不同症状相继出现。

HP:0002078.name: Truncal ataxia
HP:0002078.definition: Truncal ataxia is a sign of ataxia characterized by instability of the trunk. It usually occurs during sitting.
HP:0002078.definition_cn: 躯干共济失调是一种以躯干不稳为特征的共济失调体征，通常在坐位时出现。

HP:0002080.name: Intention tremor
HP:0002080.definition: A type of kinetic tremor that occurs during target directed movement is called intention tremor. That is, an oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).
HP:0002080.definition_cn: 一种在目标导向运动期间发生的运动性震颤称为意向性震颤。即一种小脑性共济失调，当肢体处于静止状态及自主运动的初始阶段时通常不出现，但随着运动的持续及对精确度要求的提高（例如，在触及目标如患者鼻部或医师手指时）而加重。

HP:0002083.name: Migraine without aura
HP:0002083.definition: Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.
